The country is funding the development of a Corona rapid test with six million euros. With a mobile device, it should enable very reliable analyzes of the test persons to be infected with the corona virus within 30 to 40 minutes.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: As of April 10, the Robert Koch Institute will no longer show any risk areas, as the number of infections is now high worldwide. Therefore, all regulations relating to risk areas were adjusted in the Corona Ordinance.(…) In the new Section 3a, the Ministry of Social Affairs is empowered to issue a statutory ordinance which, among other things, regulates quarantine orders for people arriving from abroad . This authorization is also related to the elimination of the risk areas. The Ministry of Social Affairs will issue a corresponding ordinance on the basis of the model regulation agreed between the federal and state governments. It essentially contains a 14-day quarantine obligation for people entering Baden-Württemberg from abroad. Until this quarantine regulation comes into force, the old § 3a continues to apply.

Measure_L3: Postponement of non-essential care and non-urgent operations in hospitals
Comment: Dental treatments (oral surgery, dentistry, oral and maxillofacial medicine, orthodontics) are only permitted in the case of acute illnesses or in emergencies.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The State Criminal Police Office now carries out SARS-CoV-2 tests for police officers itself. This leads to quick test results and thus greater planning security for the police. At the same time, the State Health Office and other examination centers are relieved.

Measure_L4: Increase domestic production of face masks
Comment: The Louis Lepoix School in Baden-Baden uses 3D printers from the “Experience 3D” project to produce facial shields to protect against infection. The school also provides instructions on how to build the masks on its website.

Measure_L4: Funding to non-profit organisations and volunteers
Comment: In the Corona crisis, the federal and state governments have agreed on another tax aid package for non-profit organizations and volunteers.

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Measure_L3: Increase delivery capacity for medical supplies
Comment: The state of Baden-Württemberg works with the companies Porsche, DB Schenker and Lufthansa Cargo to transport and distribute protective masks, glasses and protective suits.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L3: Prevalence estimation in the general population
Comment: A state-funded study aims to find out what role children under ten play in the spread of the coronavirus. Four university hospitals in the country are participating in the study, which was initiated by Prime Minister Winfried Kretschmann. How often children are the coronavirus affected and what role they play in the spread of the virus? In order to answer this question, the state government has commissioned a screening study in which four university hospitals in Baden-Württemberg want to participate. The idea came from the Prime Minister's Advisory Group on Science. “We have to quickly clarify whether we have a different starting point for children than for adults. From this we can draw conclusions for important questions about how the virus affects society, because only on the basis of scientific knowledge can we make our political decisions under clear epidemiological premises, ”said Prime Minister Winfried Kretschmann .

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L4: Asymptomatic suspected patients will be tested
Comment: In order to avoid a further sharp increase in the number of infected people, the state government is continuing to significantly expand its test capacities. Suspects without symptoms should also be tested

Measure_L4: Resume judiciary service with observance of social distancing measures
Comment: The Baden-Württemberg judiciary is gradually restarting operations. Exactly six weeks after the drastic but necessary reduction in public service operations in the Baden-Württemberg judiciary, the third violence will resume on Monday, April 27, 2020, step by step and with strict observance of distance and hygiene rules. In the meantime, numerous precautions have been taken to reduce the risk of infection in public services. This was pointed out by Justice Minister Guido Wolf .

On April 23, 2020, the cabinet passed the sixth ordinance of the state government to amend the Corona ordinance by circulation procedure . Among other things, it regulates the mandatory wearing of a non-medical everyday mask or a comparable mouth and nose cover in local public transport and in the sales rooms of shops. The new regulation will apply from next Monday, April 27, 2020.

On April 23, 2020, the cabinet passed the sixth ordinance of the state government to amend the Corona ordinance by circulation procedure . Among other things, it regulates the mandatory wearing of a non-medical everyday mask or a comparable mouth and nose cover in local public transport and in the sales rooms of shops. The new regulation will apply from next Monday, April 27, 2020.

Measure_L2: The government provide assistance to vulnerable populations
Comment: Homeless people are particularly affected by the corona crisis. With an emergency aid for the homeless, the state supports municipalities and urban and rural districts in their search for more premises for the homeless and their care.

Measure_L2: Increase in medical supplies and equipment
Comment: In order that the pharmacies in the country can continue to ensure the supply of medicines to the population, the State Chamber of Pharmacists has developed a Covid 19 medication portal in cooperation with the Ministry of Social Affairs.

The state pays another emergency aid of 100 million euros for the aid network for families and municipal facilities. The state instruments against the corona pandemic and its consequences now total up to nine billion euros.

Measure_L4: Emergency fund for students who lost their job
Comment: With an emergency aid fund, the country supports students who have lost their part-time jobs due to the corona pandemic and are in financial emergency. It's about quick and uncomplicated help, emphasizes Science Minister Theresia Bauer. Baden-Württemberg launches a student emergency fund with a million euros for hardship cases - for students who have lost their part-time jobs due to the corona pandemic and are thus in financial emergency.

Interior Minister Thomas Strobl worked with the Federal Ministry of the Interior on how to proceed on the border between Baden-Württemberg and France. In the coming week, two of the eleven border crossings currently closed are to be reopened: Nonnenweier / Gerstheim and Wintersdorf / Beinheim.

As a result of the corona pandemic, Stuttgart Airport will be closed for a good two weeks. This means that the construction work for the renovation of the runway, which is already planned, can begin prematurely.

Measure_L4: Global economic support to workers, employers and businesses
Comment: financial aid for businesses

Measure_L3: Mobilization of domestic resources for health
Comment: To relieve the medical staff at the Bavarian health authorities in the Corona crisis, the state government wants to temporarily detach 400 officials from other authorities. The employees should be withdrawn from authorities that are currently doing less because of the crisis, said Prime Minister Markus Söder (CSU) on Tuesday in Munich. Possible tasks would be organizational tasks and working on telephone hotlines
Pubs, clubs, toos and swimming pools have to close from Tuesday
public places for leisure, free time clubs, sports clubs, bars, parks
take-aways, fast-food, deliveries, private canteens) allowed, restaurants ensure 1.5 m social distance and max. 30 persons at a time
take away, delivery allowed, no gathering allowed
Declare health emergency
Charity pilot project, special facility for examination of suspected cases

Measure_L4: Measure to reduce resident density in the establishment
Comment: Prison sentences were or will be suspended in the course of March and these prisoners will be released little by little in order to reduce the risk of infection and to concentrate medical resources in the prison system

Measure_L3: Complete closure of primary and secondary schools

Comment: Berlin's universities will receive 10 million euros for the expansion of their digital teaching and examination formats. The Governing Mayor of Berlin and Senator for Science and Research, Michael Müller, decided on the “VirtualCampusBerlin” immediate program. The funds will be made available immediately to support the efforts of Berlin's universities to convert as many of the planned lectures and examinations to digital formats as possible and to offer them as early as the summer semester 2020.

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: On the basis of the Senator for Urban Development and Housing, Katrin Lompscher, and the Senator for Justice, Consumer Protection and Anti-Discrimination, Dr. Dirk Behrendt, the Senate has decided on measures to improve tenant protection and avoid housing losses for the duration of the Corona crisis.  The Senate will ensure that the municipal housing associations and berlinovo ensure that individual and accommodative solutions are agreed for the time being in the event of rent arrears, that they do not give notice of late payments and that they do not vacate occupied apartments. The same applies to commercial premises. The Senate appeals to Berlin's private landlords to do the same. In the event of violations of reporting and information requirements in accordance with the MietWoG (Rent Cover Act), sanctions will be waived until further notice due to the Corona crisis.

Measure_L2: The government provide assistance to vulnerable populations
Comment: Many homeless people regularly stay in Berlin. 1,972 homeless people were counted in the "Night of Solidarity". The onset of the corona pandemic poses a particular danger to them, as homeless people have no shelter and refuge and many of them belong to the health risk group. In order to continue to protect homeless people, the Senate will provide accommodation for the duration of the pandemic event, with 350 places for the time being, as part of the overall city responsibility. He decided this today on the basis of the Senator for Integration, Labor and Social Affairs, Elke Breitenbach. In the first step, the measure can be implemented in a youth hostel with 200 places (Kluckstraße, 10785 Berlin), which is rented for this purpose. The second location is the previous refrigeration aid facility on Storkower Strasse with up to 150 seats in the Pankow district, which is being prepared for all-day operation

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The State of Berlin has bundled all important information about the Corona Virus and its effects on the website www.berlin.de/corona . The most common questions are also available in other languages ??such as English, Turkish, Russian, Arabic and Farsi. In order to expand the range of languages, the State Office for Refugee Affairs ( LAF ), together with the integration officer of the Senate, also provided information on the coronavirus in simple language.

Measure_L3: To support law enforcement/sanction in case of no compliance
Measure_L4: Publication of a catalog of fines
Comment: The Senate also today, on presentation of the Senator for Health, Nursing and Equality Dilek Kalayci, passed a catalog of fines for punishing violations in the area of ??the Infection Protection Act (IfSG) in connection with the SARS- CoV-2 containment measures regulation. The aim is to provide the regulatory authorities with a framework for calculating the fine for violations in individual cases. The fines are given in the form of a frame. For example, the prohibited opening of a restaurant costs the operator 1,000 to 10,000 euros . A stay outside of your own apartment or accommodation without a valid reason can be punished with 10 to 100 euros . The offer of tourist accommodation offers is between 1000 and 10,000 euros.

Measure_L4: Holiday apartments cannot offer overnight stays
Comment: In the special Senate meeting, the Berlin Senate agreed, among other things, on the following changes to the regulation. Commercial excursions and city tours are not allowed, Even operators of holiday apartments are not allowed to offer tourist overnight stays.

In the special Senate meeting, the Berlin Senate agreed, among other things, on the following changes to the regulation. Commercial excursions and city tours are not allowed, Even operators of holiday apartments are not allowed to offer tourist overnight stays.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: Persons arriving at the Berlin-Tegel “Otto Lilienthal” airport from a state outside the Federal Republic of Germany, possibly after changing at an airport within the Federal Republic, or entering the city of Berlin after arriving at Berlin-Schönefeld Airport are obliged to to go straight to their apartment or ordinary accommodation immediately after their arrival and to stay there for a period of 14 days after their return

Berlin's universities will start the digital lecture period on April 20, some of them starting their online teaching earlier. In view of the corona pandemic, the Berlin summer semester 2020 should be characterized by flexibility, consideration and reliability. The Senate Chancellery - Science and Research and the state, denominational and private universities have agreed on this. Since no face-to-face events can take place until further notice, the Berlin universities are pursuing the goal of providing their students with the broadest possible range of digital teaching, learning and exam offers. We thank all students, teachers, employees and all those involved who are involved in making this extraordinary Berlin summer semester 2020 as good as possible.

At the initiative of the Governing Mayor of Berlin, Michael Müller, the work of the many employees who are particularly challenged during the corona pandemic is also being financially recognized. In a first step, the employees of the state-owned companies Vivantes and Charité should now be able to benefit from this. Charité - Universitätsmedizin Berlin and the municipal hospital group Vivantes want to pay tribute to the outstanding commitment of many hospital employees and especially nurses in the care of COVID-19 patients with additional payments: For three months in particular, employees in patient-care areas each receive 150 euros as a "Corona bonus".

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Economic support to self-employees and free-lancers
Comment: The Senate met today in an extraordinary session on the submission of Ramona Pop and Senator for Finance Dr. Matthias Kollatz agreed on further measures to support the economy. he Corona pandemic presents Berliners and the economy with unprecedented challenges. The federal state of Berlin provided rapid emergency aid with liquidity support for all companies and unbureaucratic subsidies for the self-employed and freelancers particularly affected The State of Berlin continues to see companies as having to weather this crisis. To provide targeted support to Berlin's medium-sized companies, the Senate is launching another program for companies with more than 10 and up to 100 employees. This crisis can only be overcome as a joint effort by the federal and state governments. Berlin is ready to implement federal programs quickly and supplement them with state funds. The Emergency Aid Program V with a financial volume of around € 75 million will be developed in the next few days

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L3: Incoming travelers by land and sea
Comment: Since April 3, 2020, a quarantine regulation has been in effect for travelers who reach Berlin by air. This regulation has now been extended to people who come to Berlin from abroad by land or sea. According to the applicable regulation, these persons are obliged to go directly to their own apartment or house or other suitable accommodation immediately after entering the country and to stay there for a period of 14 days after their entry. You are also obliged to contact the health authority responsible for you immediately and to inform you of your entry in the above-mentioned ways. If symptoms of illness occur, you must inform the health department immediately. The affected people are not allowed to receive visits from people who do not belong to their household during the period mentioned

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The State of Berlin will start the #BerlinGegenCorona campaign from Sunday, April 12, and will thus address the Berliners directly. The campaign campaigns for measures to contain the virus and calls for responsibility for oneself and others to protect lives. The Easter weekend started with advertisements: “The good news: solidarity is also contagious.”

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L4: Make visible to commitment of refugees in the fight against Covid-19
Comment: Refugees are committed to helping people in need to cope with the corona crisis. They do their part with creativity and energy to help and to give something back to society: they offer help with translations, relieve medical staff, support older people with shopping, are involved in the care of the homeless or work as paramedics. Together with the Senate Chancellery, GoVolunteer is now launching a campaign with two goals: The commitment of the refugees is to be made visible and more committed people are to be won over. The focus of the campaign is on portraits of committed refugees with their stories, which encourage others to participate and to help out

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: After the school closed on March 17, 2020, a few days later, supplementary support and care (after-school care) was no longer offered at primary level. In all likelihood, this will remain the case until the summer. Parents pay fees for additional support and care in the primary level from grade 3 onwards. The Senate Department for Education, Youth and Family has now agreed with the Senate Department for Finance that these fees for April will be refunded retroactively. From May onwards, the parental contribution will no longer be charged. If the schools again offer additional support and support in August, this parental contribution will be raised again from September.

Submitting an application online that is digitally processed from the first to the last step - that is one of the aims of the Berlin administration. The State of Berlin is working intensively to ensure that citizens can communicate completely online with the authorities. Various formal requirements of the Berlin state law still hinder this goal. An important step towards digitization is a regulation that has been noted today by interior and sports senator Andreas Geisel and regulates an electronic written form in 47 legal ordinances of the Berlin state law. The bill will now be sent to the Council of Mayors for comment. The main change is the new wording "in writing or electronically", so that in addition to the written form, all electronic forms, including the application via uniform Internet masks, should also be permitted. The ordinance is the result of a so-called norm screening carried out by a working group from all Senate administrations and the Senate Chancellery

Measure_L4: Only shops smaller than 800 square metres with respect of social distancing measures
Comment: From Wednesday, April 22nd, 2020, sales outlets are allowed to open a sales area of ??up to 800 square meters to the public. The following hygiene and clearance regulations must be observed: 1.5m distance, max one person per 20m2 sales area, regulated access to the shooping malls with a limited number of people, no seating or staying in the mall

Wearing a mouth-and-nose cover is strongly recommended, especially in retail stores and when in contact with high-risk individuals, to reduce the risk of infection for themselves and others. When using local public transport, a textile mouth-to-nose covering must be worn from April 27, 2020.

Measure_L3: Re-opening of outdoor attractions and touristic sites
Comment: The outside areas of Zoologischer Garten Berlin AG and Tierpark-Berlin Friedrichsfelde GmbH may be opened to the public in compliance with the hygiene rules with the exception of the animal houses. The outdoor facilities of the botanical garden may be opened from April 27, 2020 in compliance with the hygiene rules.

Public schools and privately run schools, including the facilities of the Second Education Path, may be opened for teaching from April 27, 2020 in compliance with the hygiene rules. The responsible senate administration determines more details. Definitions on the graded opening according to school types, school levels, grades and training courses as well as the admissibility of school events that take place outside of schools are made taking into account the results of a cross-border vote.
Libraries and archives of the universities may be opened for rental on April 27, 2020, taking into account the hygiene rules

Measure_L4: Provide financial support to studnets to buy necessary equiment
Comment: Studying in the digital summer semester 2020 must not fail because of the missing laptop. That is the goal of a joint initiative of the Berlin studierendenWERK and the Senate Chancellery - science and research. Due to the corona pandemic, the Berlin universities had to switch their seminars and lectures to online formats within a very short time, but not all students have the necessary equipment at home for digital studies or can afford one at short notice. A new fund from the Berlin studierendenWERK is now to help the students concerned with the purchase of the necessary equipment with grants of EUR 200 or EUR 500 as required. The Senate Chancellery - Science and Research - is making the first funds available in the amount of 50,000 euros.Berlin companies are also encouraged to contribute to this initiative with donations and to support the specialists of tomorrow. The Berliner Sparkasse has already agreed to support you and is making a large donation of 25,000 euros. Students can apply for funding from May 4 on the website of the studierendenWERK Berlin. With a donation of 200 euros (for small needs such as a camera, headphones or internet access) or 500 euros (for a laptop), studierendenWERK Berlin can provide a Berlin student with the equipment they need to study online. The studierendenWERK will of course issue donation receipts at the end of 2020.

Measure_L3: Fixed open-air gatherings and religious events allowed
Comment: From May 4, 2020, fixed open-air gatherings and religious events with up to 50 participants are permitted, provided the minimum distance and compliance with the hygiene rules are guaranteed.

Museums, memorials and similar educational institutions in public and private sponsorship can be opened from May 4, 2020 in compliance with the hygiene rules. Public libraries may be opened for lending from May 4, 2020, in compliance with the hygiene rules.
Hairdressers may reopen from May 4th, 2020.

Should such a person be reported, the medical service at the airport will be informed, a physician will examine the patient on board and decide on further procedure.

This no longer only affects air travelers from China, but also from Italy, Japan, South Korea and Iran. In future, travelers should also receive information not only on airplanes and airports, but also on trains and buses about how they can recognize the respiratory disease and how they can protect themselves against it.

Measure_L4: Limit up to 2 persons of different households
Comment: In view of the corona pandemic in Germany, the existing restrictions on social contacts in public space will be extended until April 19. Chancellor Merkel and the heads of government of the federal states have agreed on a common approach. In their joint decision , the federal and state governments make it clear once again that the contact restrictions also apply to Easter. "Citizens are required to reduce contact with other people outside of their own household to an absolute minimum, even during Easter, in accordance with the applicable rules," emphasized the Chancellor. She appealed to the citizens to refrain from private trips and visits - also from relatives. "This also applies in Germany and for national day-trip excursions," said Merkel.

Measure_L4: No movements allowed before and during holidays
Comment: In view of the corona pandemic in Germany, the existing restrictions on social contacts in public space will be extended until April 19. Chancellor Merkel and the heads of government of the federal states have agreed on a common approach. In their joint decision , the federal and state governments make it clear once again that the contact restrictions also apply to Easter. "Citizens are required to reduce contact with other people outside of their own household to an absolute minimum, even during Easter, in accordance with the applicable rules," emphasized the Chancellor. She appealed to the citizens to refrain from private trips and visits - also from relatives. "This also applies in Germany and for national day-trip excursions," said Merkel.

Baden-Württemberg introduces the Covid-19 Resource Board, which provides a real-time overview of the hospital capacities for COVID-19 patients nationwide. The hospitals report their intensive care and ventilation places online

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Facilitate loans for entrepreneurs and businesses
Comment: A modification was also agreed to the existing Kreditanstalt für Wiederaufbau (KfW) loan program. The aim of the new " KfW rapid loan 2020" is to support small and medium businesses in particular with swift liquidity assistance. Up to a ceiling of 800,000 euros. KfW loans totaling up to three months turnover will be awarded, with 100 per cent exemption from liability.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: As of 10/04/2020 countries and regions are not longer classified as international risk areas. Due to pandemic spread, there is a global risk of acquiring COVID-19. In a considerable number of countries there are outbreaks with sometimes large numbers of cases. the exact numbers of cases in other countries are not known. Therefore there is a risk of transmission in Germany as well as in a vast number of regions worldwide. All persons entering Germany are required to remain in quarantine for 14 days.

Measure_L4: Limit up to 2 persons of different households
Comment: The contact restrictions that have been in force since mid-March will generally be extended until May 3, 2020

The fight against the corona virus and the associated goal of curbing the spread of the virus also has an inevitable impact on the federal government's event planning. The items valued at GH¢53,000.00 included protective masks, stainless steel step bins, gowns, infrared thermometer guns, hand sanitizers, bags of local rice, and packs of bottled water.

Fellow Ghanaians, it is vital that we protect the lives of our frontline health workers, who are risking their lives every day to battle this virus. That is why Government is placing a high priority on the procurement of personal protective equipment (PPEs) for them. Thus far, three hundred and fifty thousand (350,000) masks, five hundred and fifty eight thousand, six hundred and fifty (558,650) examination gloves, one thousand (1,000) reusable goggles, twenty thousand (20,000) cover-alls, seven thousand (7,000) N-95 respirators, five hundred (500) waterproof gumboots, two thousand (2,000) reusable face shields, two thousand (2,000) gallons of hand sanitizers, ten thousand (10,000) 100ml pieces of hand sanitizers, and five hundred (500) shoe covers have been sent to the regional health directorates, for onward distribution to the district health directorates for use by our health workers in all the districts.

It is for this reason that Government is actively engaged with local manufacturing companies to assist them in the domestic production of PPEs., and I am encouraged by the response from the Ghanaian private sector. Domestic production of face masks, head covers, surgical scrubs and gowns will commence from Tuesday. For example, three million, six hundred thousand face masks will be produced domestically, with an output of one hundred and fifty thousand (150,000) per day.

An insurance package, with an assured sum of three hundred and fifty thousand cedis (GH¢350,000) for each health personnel and allied professional at the forefront of the fight, has been put in place, with a daily allowance of one hundred and fifty cedis (GH¢150) being paid to contact tracers.
Government has also decided that all health workers will not pay taxes on their emoluments for the next three months, i.e. April, May and June.

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Measure_L4: Government fully absorb electricity bills for vulnerable populations
Comment: We have decided on further measures of mitigation for all Ghanaians for the next three months, i.e. April, May and June. Government will fully absorb electricity bills for the poorest of the poor, i.e. for all lifeline consumers, that is free electricity for persons who consume zero (0) to fifty (50) kilowatt hours a month for this period.

Measure_L3: Restriction on private and familial events
Comment: We are used to attending Easter Conventions, making-merry, visiting friends and family, and having a good time. Yes, like a lot of you, I was also looking forward to visiting Kwahu during this time of the year, which I have been doing for several years. However, I am urging all of us to do the exact opposite of what we have been used to for many years. Stay at home. I ask you to keep your distance from your parents, grandparents and extended family, and celebrate this holiday apart. Do not host a big family gathering, and sternly refuse to attend one if you are invited. Your relatives will understand you are doing this out of love for them. Please, make that sacrifice

Measure_L3: To support law enforcement/sanction in case of no compliance
Comment: The non-wearing of face masks in public is now punishable by law per an Executive Instrument, E.I. 164, signed by President Akufo-Addo on June 15. Section 6 of Act 1012 states that “a person who fails to comply with the restrictions imposed under the Executive Instrument issued under subsection 1 of Section 2 commits an offence and is liable on summary conviction to a fine of not less than 1,000 penalty unit (Gh¢12,000) and not more than 5,000 penalty units (Gh¢ 60,000) or to a term of imprisonment not less than four years and not more than 10 years or to both.” Section 4 (1) of the E.I. 164 states that the police have the authority to make random checks to “ensure enforcement compliance”

Comment: The Ministry of Health has already recruited and 176 doctors and 733 nurses and other staff have been recruited in hospitals across the country. Another 2,145 recruitments have already been approved and in more detail, 431 doctors and 1,714 nurses and other staff. They will be hired within the next ten days. Every day other recruitments of doctors, nurses and other staff are approved, according to the needs that arise in our hospitals.

However, 2 months ago the E.S.Y. had 565 ICU beds. To these we added 80 ICU beds from the private sector to exacerbate the flu virus. Today, the NSS has 685 ICU and MAF beds. And we go on. Others are added daily.  39 MAF beds have already been converted into ICUs and we have already received another 107 ICU beds from the private sector. We have also added to the system 38 ICU beds from military hospitals, as well as the entire NIMTS hospital that will be used as a coronary hospital.

The beds that have already been developed for the simple treatment of patients with COVID-19 are currently 2,158. These numbers will continue to rise, based on the needs and plan drawn up by the Ministry of Health, passing from one phase of the virus to another. At this stage, the PAMMAKARISTOS hospital with 60 beds, NIMTS, wings at AGIA VARVARA with 56 beds and the private hospital ATTICA in Elefsina with 300 beds, will treat exclusively patients with COVID-19.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L3: Prevalence estimation in the general population
Comment: Hungary’s medical universities are launching a screening program on Friday to estimate the actual number of people infected with the coronavirus and their spread across the country. Béla Merkely, the head of Budapest’s Semmelweis University, said PCR tests will be conducted with a representative sample of some 18,000 people over the age of 14. The results could show how many people have contracted the virus so far, how many have acquired immunity and how many may still be transmitting the virus while showing no symptoms themselves. Concerning the actual tests, Merkely said that both mucus and blood samples would be used to detect presence of the virus as well as the patient’s immune reaction to an earlier infection. The tests will be conducted between May 1-14, at GPs’ offices, local outpatient clinics and on special buses, while the results of the national survey are expected to come back before the end of May, the professor said.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: Icelandic companies that have suffered substantial revenue losses due to the COVID-19 crisis will be given the opportunity to apply for government support to pay a portion of salary costs during the employee notice period, protecting workers’ rights and preventing a wave of corporate insolvencies. In order to protect workers’ rights and avoid insolvencies, companies will be given the opportunity to apply for government support to pay a portion of salary costs for any staff member during their notice period. This support will take the form of payment up to ISK 633,000 per month for up to three months, plus vacation pay. It is limited to those companies that have suffered at least a 75% loss in revenue and are forecasting continued revenue losses at least through 2020. An estimated quarter of Icelandic companies are anticipated to be eligible for this support.Government support will be capped at a ratio of 85%. These employees will have priority access to jobs when business activities resume, and will retain certain specified accrued rights from that employer. Further measures will be put in place to assess or protect operational viability, participation in this measure, and right of recourse for the employees. This government support will be available from 1 May through 30 September.

Indonesia will issue a government regulation in lieu of law (Perppu) that will boost state spending by up to Rp 405.1 trillion (US$24.6 billion) as the budget deficit is anticipated to widen to 5.07 percent of GDP in the nation’s fight against COVID-19. Of the extra spending, the government will allocate Rp 75 trillion for healthcare spending, Rp 110 trillion for social protection and Rp 70.1 trillion for tax incentives and credit for enterprises. The biggest chunk, Rp 150 trillion, will be set aside for economic recovery programs including credit restructuring and financing for small and medium businesses.

Comment: The Head of the Indonesia Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM) has issued the Decree of the Head of Indonesia Investment Coordinating Board (BKPM) No. 86/2020 on Providing Ease of Business Licensing for Certain Business Fields Related to the Handling of COVID-19. Through this decree, certain business fields, including the medical device industry and the pharmaceutical industry, are given an ease in business licensing in the form of: reduction and/or facilitation of business licensing requirements, acceleration on the business licensing process, special assistance services. The decree has come into effect since April 1, 2020, and will last until the end of the COVID-19 emergency response status as declared by the Head of National Disaster Management Agency.

Comment: The Ministry of Trade is allowing the imports of used and refurbished medical devices, as well as reopening, in strict terms, the export of face masks and other personal protective equipment. Minister of Trade Regulation No. 37/2020, which amends Minister of Trade Regulation No. 118/2018 on the Provisions of Imports on Used and Refurbished Capital Goods, allows the importing of used and refurbished capital goods as long as it is done with the recommendation of the head of the COVID-19 taskforce, and that these capital goods are eligible for special treatment. This regulation has taken effect on April 2, 2020 and will apply until June 30, 2020

Comment: On March 31, 2020, the Ministry of Trade issued Trade Minister Regulation Number 34 of 2020 on the Second Amendment to Trade Minister Regulation Number 23 of 2020 (Trade Minister Regulation No. 23/2020) on the Temporary Export Ban for Antiseptic, Mask Raw Material, Personal Protective Equipment, and Masks (Trade Minister Regulation No. 34/2020). The second amendment stipulates that the Minister of Trade can determine an exemption to the provisions in this regulation, carried out in coordination with the relevant ministries or non-ministerial government institutions. In order to obtain an exemption, the exporter must submit an application electronically to the Director General of Foreign Trade through http://inatrade.kemendag.go.id. This regulation has come into force on April 1, 2020, and is retroactively effective since March 18, 2020.

The Indonesian Government has officially shifted the national holiday season to December 2020 from May 2020 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic. Joint minister decree of the Minister of Religious Affairs, Minister of Manpower, and Minister of Administrative and Bureaucratic Reform No. 391, No. 02, and No. 02 of 2020 on National Holidays and Collective Leave Days amend Joint Minister Decree No. 728, No. 213, and No. 01 of 2019 by giving additional collective leave days at the end of the year.

The regulation lays out additional incentives for KB and KITE companies in the form of, but not limited to, allowances to expand production, ease in delivery of the produced goods and tax incentives for the delivery of local raw materials.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, the government has decided to postpone the 20th National Sporting Week (Pekan Olahraga Nasional or PON) to October 2021 from the initially planned October 2020, as announced by Sports and Youth Minister Zainuddin Amali. The decision is based on the difficulty of organizing a proper event due to the various restrictions imposed by the COVID-19 pandemic.

The Indonesian Government will officially ban citizens from participating in the exodus tradition celebrated during the Islamic holiday Idul-Fitri. Locally known as “mudik” or “pulang kampung”, which translates to going back home, Coordinating Minister of Maritime Affairs and Investments, and Ad interim Minister of Transportation, Luhut B. Pandjaitan said the ban would be applied starting April 24 and that the enforcement of sanctions would start on May 7. The ban was decided by President Joko Widodo in a cabinet meeting on April 21.

From 24 April until 8 June, the government suspends all passenger to travel outside areas with at least one confirmed case, regions that had imposed large-scale social restrictions (PSBB), and those that had been declared COVID-19 red zones. The ban applies to all types of public and private transportation by air, sea, land, and railway, except for vehicles carrying leaders of state institutions, police and military vehicles, ambulances, fire trucks, hearses and vehicles transporting logistical supplies, staple goods and medicines

The Indonesian government has postponed the 2020 regional elections in order to prevent any further spread of COVID-19. Under Presidential Regulation No. 2/2020 on the Election of Governors, Regents and Mayors, signed on May 4, 2020, regional elections are to be postponed during times of national disasters and that the 2020 regional elections would be postponed until December, with a potential for further postponement should the national disaster persist.

Measure_L4: Guaranty payment of holiday bonus during the epidemic
Comment: The Ministry of Manpower has issued Circular No. M/67/HI.00.0-1/V/2020 on the Handout of Holiday Bonus for 2020 During the COVID-19 Pandemic. The Circular stipulates that, while Governors should ensure that companies located in their respective provinces pay their employees their legally due annual holiday bonus (Tunjangan Hari Raya or THR), the companies that are unable to do so due to economic disruption, caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, may do so by paying the bonus in installments or delay the THR payment to a later date agreed upon between the employees and the employer as an alternative solution. This Circular was issued on May 6, 2020.

Jakarta Governor Anies Baswedan has issued Jakarta Governor Decree No. 380/2020 on the Enforcement of Large-Scale Social Restriction (PSBB) in the handling of COVID-19 in Jakarta, as well as Jakarta Governor Regulation No. 33/2020 on the Implementation of PSBB in the handling of COVID-19 in Jakarta. Both documents mark the legal start of the PSBB status in Jakarta, which has come into effect on April 10 and will last until April 24. The Central Government of Indonesia and the Regional Government of DKI Jakarta have taken one of the options for Health Quarantine Action, namely by setting the policy “Large-Scale Social Restrictions (PSBB)” in full as of April 10, 2020. The policy is in addition to being able to prevent the potential spread of the virus COVID-19, will also have implications for the limitations in the lives of citizens, especially residents who live in the Jakarta area, including for refugee communities living in Jakarta Area. Each person must: implement Clean and Healthy Behavior (PHBS), use a mask outside home --- On April 3, Indonesia released two regulations, a government regulation and a Health Ministry regulation, to pave the way for large-scale social restrictions (PSBB), the country’s equivalent to partial lockdown. A week later, Jakarta became the first region to implement the partial lockdown to contain the spread of COVID-19.

Measure_L4: Practical guide for those who take care of the elderly
Comment: The Higher Institute of Health (ISS) has created and published on its website the booklet "Practical guide for those who take care of the elderly" aimed at providing useful and practical advice, especially to carers. The document specifies a note from the ISS “offers indications on how to protect the elderly by protecting themselves, since taking care of an elderly person means helping him to get up, walk, eat and wash and therefore it is not possible to keep the distance of at least one meter ". In the document, in particular, there is information on the coronavirus, indications on how to assist the elderly when they are at home and when they are away from home, on how to behave if you have the doubt of having contracted the infection, but also on how correctly wear mask and gloves,on how to wash your hands and how to ensure proper home and environment hygiene. The brochure has been translated into 8 languages, English, French, Spanish, Romanian, Polish, Russian, Portuguese and Tamil and will also be made available in the form of a decalogue to be launched on social networks and distributed in a printable version, as a poster, in pharmacies, medical offices, hospitals

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public

To move safely during Phase 2 of the pandemic in our country, I have followed the recommendations for public transport passengers, the  guidelines contained in Annex 9 of the Prime Minister's Decree of 26 April  and references to circulars (…) You must necessarily wear a mask, also made of fabric, for the protection of the nose and mouth

Measure_L3: Communication targets protection of vulnerable populations
Measure_L4: Hotline for psychological support during covid-19 crisis
Comment: The Covid-19 emergency is putting a strain on the psychological stability of people dealing with an unprecedented situation in its drama. The fear of contagion, the measures of isolation, as indispensable on a health level as they are difficult on the human level, loneliness, mourning, economic uncertainties: all elements that can give rise to attacks of anxiety, stress, fears, discomfort. For these reasons, the psychological toll-free number 800.833.833 , activated by the Ministry of Health and Civil Protection , will be operational from April 27 , with the technological support offered free of charge by TIM. A number chosen paying tribute to the Law 23 December 1978, number 833, which established the National Health Service. The number will also be reachable from abroad on 02.20228733 and access methods will also be provided for the deaf.

Comment: For trips to the national economic supply, the relief ordered by the Federal Roads Office (FEDRO) with regard to: the permissible total weight of heavy motor vehicles. and the driving and rest times of professional drivers. Trips for the transport of supply-relevant goods (including goods for daily use) are also excluded from the Sunday and night driving ban.

The current coronavirus epidemic is also having an impact on the services of the Office for Road Traffic. On March 25, 2020, the government therefore decided to take the following measures retrospectively from March 9, 2020 to September 30, 2020 at the latest: The validity of expired driving authorizations or driving licenses will be extended by 6 months until September 30, 2020. The new documents are issued by the Road Traffic Office and are free of charge. The periodic medical check-ups have been suspended. Drivers license holders do not have to pay attention to bids that have already been made.
Drive-Thru-Testanlage

Since the extent of the pandemic cannot be conclusively estimated at the moment and the human resources in the country itself are limited, the government has submitted a request for assistance on the basis of the assistance agreement concluded with Switzerland, in the context of which additional personnel are requested to support the health care system. On Wednesday, April 1, 2020, Switzerland announced that the request for assistance will be taken into account in the overall planning of the armed forces. Specifically, this means that Switzerland will provide Liechtenstein with 16 medical soldiers if necessary. In order to be able to prepare for this possible deployment, representatives of the army on site will get an idea of ??their future deployment location on Thursday, April 2, 2020. In the coming week, the medical soldiers will be familiarized with the local conditions and prepared for their possible deployment during two induction days. After this training course, the army returns to Frauenfeld. The readiness for the assistance of the army in challenging times like these is an expression of the deep bond between the two countries.

After carefully weighing all the circumstances, the government has come to the conclusion to postpone the referendums scheduled for June 7, 2020 on the initiative request "HalbeHalbe" to amend the state constitution and on the amendment of the civil rights law (dual citizenship for naturalizations). A new voting date is set depending on the further developments of the pandemic.

At its meeting on April 7, 2020, the government passed the ordinance on temporary adjustments in the sports sector for the "Youth and Sport" program as a result of the coronavirus (COVID-19). In Switzerland and Liechtenstein, measures to combat the coronavirus have also been adopted in the field of sports and sports events and club activities have been prohibited. Accordingly, the Youth and Sport program was suspended. There are currently no more youth and sports activities such as training courses and camps. The training courses and advanced training modules in the field of youth and sport were also canceled until June 30, 2020.

Comment: Truthful, reliable and up-to-date information on emergency, quarantine and coronavirus from official sources is crucial today. In order to facilitate the provision of such information to the public an automated  conversation robot called ViLT? was installed at www.koronastop.lt. This is a new way to get information quickly and at any time during the day, which is particularly relevant when the number of coronavirus cases is increasing and more people are turning to helplines on a wide range of issues in the country. This virtual conversation robot, working with the help of artificial intelligence, can already understand and provide official and reliable answers in Lithuanian and English to thousands of citizens’ questions about coronavirus, travel restrictions, public support for business and many others.

Credit card holders with financial constraints may choose to convert their credit card balance to term loans. The flexibility of delaying this credit card repayment can be taken advantage of by borrowers from April 1, 2020 to December 31, 2020. The corporate sector can consult with their respective banks to restructure their repayments to suit their business circumstances. This is important to enable companies to remain able to maintain their jobs and to continue their business activities

PUTRAJAYA, 6th April 2020 – The “Solidarity Trial”, launched by the World Health Organization (WHO), will see Malaysia’s involvement in an international effort to test several drugs in treating COVID-19. The WHO globally coordinated trial is an unprecedented effort to collect reliable data and compare the safety and effectiveness of four treatment protocols using different combinations of Remdesivir, Lopinavir/Ritonavir, Interferon beta, Chloroquine and Hydroxychloroquine. The Director General of Health, Ministry of Health (MOH) Malaysia Datuk Dr Noor Hisham Abdullah said, MOH has fast-tracked the process to implement the drug trials to treat patients with COVID-19, which will begin soon. The nine MOH hospitals included are Tuanku Fauziah Hospital, Sultanah Bahiyah Hospital, Pulau Pinang Hospital, Sungai Buloh Hospital, Kuala Lumpur Hospital, Melaka Hospital, Tengku Ampuan Afzan Hospital, Sarawak General Hospital and Queen Elizabeth Hospital

This is an addition to the other economic stimulus packages for the people to increase cash-flow to ensure the economy does not collapse. Muhyiddin had on March 27 unveiled an economic stimulus package known as pakej prihatin (caring package) valued at RM250bil.

Measure_L4: Extend testing capacity to private institutions
Comment: KUALA LUMPUR, April 8 — A consortium of three associated laboratories namely Gribbles Pathology (Malaysia), Quantum Diagnostics and Clinipath Malaysia today launched the country’s largest Covid-19 collection and testing programme to assist the country’s effort to flatten the curve of infection. In a statement today, the consortium chairman Tan Sri Datuk Dr Yahya Awang said the patients will have access to reliable and quicker testing at an affordable price while both the government and the medical community recognise the need to ramp up testing for the virus in Malaysia.

Malaysian public universities’ research and scientific capacity can be galvanised to join the fight against the Covid-19 pandemic. Recently, 10 diagnostic laboratories at public higher learning institutions nationwide have been roped in as part of a joint initiative by the Higher Education and Science, Technology and Innovation Ministries. The laboratories serve to help the Health Ministry in conducting 16,500 Covid-19 tests daily. Canselor Tuanku Mukhriz Hospital (HCTM) director Professor Datuk Dr Hanafiah Harunarashid said advanced laboratories at public universities can perform the tests that meet the high standards set by health authorities. “We are boosting the testing capacity with the help of the Higher Education and Science, Technology and Innovation Ministries.”

KUALA LUMPUR (Reuters) - Malaysian authorities on Saturday defended plans to ease coronavirus lockdown measures next week even as the number of new infections jumped to a two-week high. Most businesses will reopen on Monday (May 4) after a six-week shutdown ordered to fight the COVID-19 outbreak, though schools, cinemas and nightclubs will remain closed, along with the country’s borders, and mass gatherings will still be banned.

As part of the strategy that the federal government carries out to combat the pandemic COVID-19, by instructions of President Andrés Manuel López Obrador, and in accordance with the powers set forth in the Organic Law of the Federal Public Administration, the Ministry of Relations Exterior (SRE) has carried out actions to search for and identify medical supplies abroad for the population and health workers. To finalize the purchase of these supplies, which is made by the Ministry of Health through the Institute of Health for Welfare, the SRE installed an airlift with the People's Republic of China. The supplies acquired by the health sector, among which are personal protective equipment, medicines and ventilators, have all the international sanitary certifications and comply with the national regulations established by the Ministry of Health and the Federal Commission for the Protection against Risks Sanitary (Cofepris).

Measure_L3: Return operation of nationals on Westerdam
Comment: 39 Dutch passengers who were on the cruise ship Westerdam arrived at Schiphol this morning. They left Cambodia on Thursday with dozens of other cruise ship passengers. On arrival in the Netherlands, the Dutch passengers will be monitored by the GGD for another 2 weeks for any symptoms of illness

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: An infection with the new coronavirus was found in a male patient in the Elisabeth-TweeSteden Hospital (ETZ) in Tilburg. RIVM confirmed this on Thursday February 27, on the basis of laboratory research by RIVM itself. The patient recently visited Lombardy, Italy, and was immediately hospitalized. The GGD maps contacts of this patient by means of contact research. The new coronavirus can spread through drops. For example, if someone coughs or sneezes in someone else's face. To prevent the disease from spreading further in the Netherlands, the GGD and RIVM map out who has had close contact with the infected patient. These persons (called contacts) are monitored and have to take their temperature twice a day and report this to the GGD. They should also report any other complaints they have. These measures reduce the chance that the disease can spread in the Netherlands. RIVM remains alert to possible new infections and applies the same protocol when new infections are found: isolation, contact research and continuous monitoring of the patient

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The GGD Municipal Health Service  are busy mapping out the contacts of all patients. All contacts are placed under monitoring by the GGD for 14 days after their last contact with the patient and must monitor their health and inform the GGD. In addition to this, family contacts are asked to stay at home and to have as little physical contact with other people as possible. The contacts are tested in case of comp

Measure_L3: Measures to limit contact to hospital patients
Measure_L4: 1 IC partially closed admission of new patients
Comment: Recording stop IC intensive care department Maasstad Hospital: One of the patients has been in intensive care at Maasstad Hospital. The hospital has now instituted a partial admission stop in the intensive care unit as a precaution. This means that no new patients are admitted to this department. The hospital will also remain open. The hospital and the GGD map out the patient's contacts (visitors and caregivers) and check whether they have complaints. All contacts of the patients who have colds or fever have been asked to stay at home. They are tested if necessary.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L4: Map of the positive results per municipality
Comment: Since March 3, RIVM has also published a map in which the positive results are listed per municipality . This card is updated every day to reflect the new figures. The map shows the total number of patients tested positive. It is not a map with the current number of sick people in the Netherlands. RIVM currently does not provide data about people who have recovered.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures

Measure_L3: Warning against travel to and return from high risk areas
Comment: Many of the new patients have recently been in Northern Italy. In several northern Italian provinces there is widespread circulation of the corona virus. Thus, people traveling in Northern Italy are more likely to become infected with the coronavirus. Travelers can then take the virus to the Netherlands unnoticed. That is why the Ministry of Foreign Affairs has adapted the travel advice for Northern Italy to only necessary travel.

Measure_L4: Visit restriction in prisons and youth detention centers
Comment: As of tomorrow, the visit to detainees will be suspended in all judicial institutions. In order to continue the contact as much as possible, wider options for telephone contact are offered and, where possible, via Skype. Only the visit that is necessary in the context of the legal process, such as a lawyer (and which cannot be done with digital tools, for example) can continue. Young people in a correctional institution for juvenile offenders may still receive visits from their parents or legal guardians. In addition, where possible, detainees will attend hearings through an image connection from prison. This is to minimize the risk of spreading the virus through transport

Measure_L4: Close long-term care facilities for visitors
Comment: Nursing homes and small-scale housing in elderly care will be closed from tomorrow for visitors and others who are not necessary for basic care. Vulnerable elderly people run the greatest risks of becoming very ill from COVID-19. By closing nursing homes for visitors now, the Cabinet wants to work with the healthcare sector to better protect vulnerable residents

Measure_L3: Support e-learning for children in vulnerable environment
Comment: Minister Slob (education) is taking measures together with schools and municipalities to provide extra support to children in a vulnerable environment now that they cannot physically go to school. Pupils who do not have a laptop or tablet at home are supported in this by their school and municipality. SIVON, an ICT cooperative of school boards in primary and secondary education, will support where necessary with temporary extra facilities. She will receive 2.5 million euros to arrange this. In addition to the children who are supported by schools and municipalities, thousands of children can be helped in this way.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L4: Phone alert sent by the government
Comment: On Sunday morning, March 22, an NL Alert (phone alert sent by the government on all phones) was sent to alert people to the most important instructions to prevent the spread of the coronavirus. The NL-Alert has been broadcast throughout the Netherlands and was sent from the National Crisis Center in The Hague. The text of the NL-Alert is: Follow the instructions of the national government: keep 1.5 meters away! Are you sick or have a cold? Stay at home. Protect yourself and those around you. Together against corona. Keep your distance to others.

To this end, the organizations have decided to take the enhanced special foreign assistance approach: website, 10 million euros for assistance scheme

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Stay at home as much as possible. Go outside for work only when you cannot work at home, for groceries, or to take care of others. You can get a breath of fresh air, but don't do this in a group. Always keep a distance from others (at least 1.5 meters) and avoid social activities and groups of people. Also at home: a maximum of three people visit and keep a distance from each other

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L3: Promote self-initiated isolation of people with mild respiratory symptoms
Comment: If you have a cough, cough and / or a cold, the following already applies: stay at home. If you also get a fever, everyone in the household must stay at home from now on. People in crucial professions and vital processes are excluded from this, unless they become ill themselves.

Measure_L3: Restriction on private and familial events
Comment: All meetings are prohibited until June 1 (instead of April 6), even with fewer than 100 people. There is an exception for funerals and church weddings
Shops and public transport are required to take measures to ensure that people keep their distance, for example through a door policy.
Shops and public transport are required to take measures to ensure that people keep their distance, for example through a door policy.

Measure_L4: Closure of hairdressers, beauticians, make-up artists, pedicures, nail salons, driving instructors and tattooists, and other professions in the field of extra-care
Comment: Until April 6, hairdressers, beauticians, make-up artists, pedicures, nail salons, driving instructors and tattooists, and other professions in the field of extra-care are unfortunately not allowed to practice their profession. For physiotherapists, for example, work as much as possible via video calling.

Measure_L4: Holiday parks: when 1,5m distance not possible
Comment: At locations such as holiday parks, measures must be taken to allow people to keep 1.5 meters away. If one is not able to do this, municipalities may close these locations.

Measure_L4: Partial: when sufficient distance is not respected
Comment: Markets are excluded from this because they are an essential part of the food chain in some places in the country. Municipalities and market masters must however look at how they can ensure that sufficient distance is guaranteed.

Measure_L3: Transfer or enforcement of decisional and legal power
Comment: The government also wants to be able to better enforce the existing measures. That is why mayors are given the opportunity to act more quickly and easily through an emergency ordinance. Mayors can close specific locations, such as parks, beaches, and campgrounds. Fines can also be imposed

Measure_L3: Measures to limit contact to long-term care facilities
Comment: New visitors scheme for care for the disabled and mental health care: The visitors' scheme for care for the disabled is based on the principle: no, unless. There is no visit unless contact with the family or volunteer is essential to the client. In that case, one resident may receive a maximum of one person per day for a maximum of one hour, provided the visitor is free of complaints. Care organizations determine whether visitors are allowed to enter the location. If corona is detected anywhere, a total visit ban will apply. Efforts are made to provide easy-to-understand communication about the visitors' scheme. Visits are encouraged to continue the contact in other ways, such as through WhatsApp and video calling. Care providers and others will naturally understand the actions and emotional statements of clients given the special crisis situation we are dealing with
Casinos are now subject to the same measure as food and beverage outlets and will close on March 24, 2020.

Responsible Shopping Guidelines: With guidelines for retailers and their customers, business organizations and the Ministry of Economic Affairs and Climate want to ensure that people can make their purchases as responsibly as possible and store employees can work in a safe manner. The measures are intended to prevent infections with the corona virus and to limit the consequences of the new virus

A service document 'Opportunities for distance education for civic integration during the corona period' has been drawn up by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Employment with all parties involved, including the Blik op Werk and the Education Implementation Service (DUO)

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: Due to the corona crisis, many healthcare providers experience financial uncertainty, because they unexpectedly have to provide much more care or, on the contrary, much less. The ministries of VWS and JenV and the VNG have therefore made agreements about guaranteeing financial security for healthcare providers within the Social Support Act and the Youth Act

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: No evictions and extension of temporary lease contracts

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support tourism, sport and culture sectors
Comment: The rent of government-subsidized museums is suspended for three months. This offers them financial space at the time of the corona crisis. The measure is part of an additional package for the culture and creative sector, about which Minister Van Engelshoven (Culture) sent a letter to the House of Representatives today.

Measure_L4: For the reception of homeless people
Comment: The Ministry of VWS, in collaboration with Valente, VNG and COMO, has adopted a guideline on how to organize the reception of homeless people during the corona crisis (COVID-19). The guideline is intended for municipalities and reception organizations and ensures that homeless people are received as well as possible, while at the same time minimizing the risk of infection

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Today the website corona.steffie.nl has started. This website explains how Steffie explains difficult information about the new coronavirus in a simple way. The website is specially designed for people who like a step-by-step explanation with a lot of image. Like people with intellectual disabilities. The website was commissioned by the national government. With the website, the well-known web help Steffie wants to meet the growing demand for reliable and understandable information for vulnerable target groups, such as people with mild intellectual disabilities and low-literate persons

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: Possibility to postpone tax declaration

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: Since April 6, all healthcare workers inside and outside hospitals who provide direct care to patients or clients can be tested if they have symptoms of COVID-19 (cough and / or nasal colds and / or fever) for at least 24 hours. People who have a higher risk of severe course of COVID-19 can also be tested. In addition, professionals, in the police and in enforcement and supervision can also be tested.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Global economic support to workers, employers and businesses
Comment: The cabinet has today taken additional measures to support entrepreneurs because of the economic consequences of the corona virus. This includes additional financing through the Ondernemersfekering Guarantee (GO scheme) and specific credit options for start-ups and scale-ups. In addition, the premium for the extended scheme for the Guarantee of Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (BMKB) will be reduced. The government will also reinsure supplier credit up to an amount of twelve billion euros. In addition, more companies will receive a one-off gift as a contribution to the consequences of measures taken by the government to combat the corona virus

A faster licensing procedure will be introduced for companies and laboratories that want to test medicines and vaccines with genetically modified organisms (GMOs). On the proposal of Minister Van Nieuwenhuizen of Infrastructure and Water Management, the Council of Ministers has agreed to accelerate this procedure for most applications from 120 days now to a maximum of 56 days. This will allow these pharmaceutical companies to test their newly developed gene therapies and vaccines in practice more quickly through clinical research. In addition to this structural shortening of the procedure, Van Nieuwenhuizen also instituted an urgent GMO research procedure for Covid-19 last week. This ensures that GMO permits aimed at developing a drug or vaccine to combat the coronavirus can be issued within 28 days. In principle, this Covid-19 emergency procedure is valid for one year. The procedure has been shortened in order to offer innovation as much scope as possible, without this being at the expense of safety for people and the environment

On Tuesday, the Senate approved the urgent law on digital decision-making for local authorities. With this law, municipal councils, provincial states, water boards and island councils will soon be able to take legally valid decisions through a digital meeting. In the first instance, the law will apply until 1 September this year with the option to extend. apporved on APril 21

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Economic support to the most affected workers and businesses
Comment: Due to the economic consequences of corona, Dutch entrepreneurs can apply to be eligible for exceptional financial support from the cabinet through the temporary scheme for wage costs (NOW) or extra support for self-employed persons. Companies can also make use of the various tax measures and broadened possibilities for bridging loans. This emergency economy and jobs package also includes the announced so-called Emergency Desk (regulation of the Ministry of Economic Affairs for affected sectors) with a one-off contribution of 4,000 euros. This scheme is intended for entrepreneurs in specific sectors who are affected by government measures such as the (mandatory) closure of food and beverage outlets and the ban on contact professions in, for example, external care

Measure_L4: Partial: holiday parks, camping sites, parks, natural reserves, beaches
Comment: Locations such as holiday parks, camping sites, parks, nature reserves and beaches will be closed if these locations do not or insufficiently follow the applicable hygiene measures and the 1.5 m distance or this is likely to occur

Group formation (accidentally or otherwise) in public space is prohibited. The cabinet understands a group of three or more people who do not keep a distance of 1.5 m. There is no group formation when it comes to persons who form a joint household. There is also no group formation when children up to the age of 12 play together under the supervision of one or more parents or guardians. Provided that the parents and / or guardians keep 1.5 m distance from each other

The emergency fund of Food Banks Netherlands receives financial aid from the cabinet. That has been decided by State Secretary Van Ark (SZW) and Minister Schouten (LNV). A one-off subsidy of € 4 million will be made available as a safety net for the emergency fund. This is done in the context of the Cabinet's Corona crisis measures

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L3: Communication targets protection of vulnerable populations
Measure_L4: Protection of women and children against domestic violence
Comment: Today, the Ministry of Health, Welfare and Sport and the Ministry of Justice and Security are launching a new campaign against domestic violence. Under the well-known motto 'It doesn't stop until you do something', this campaign helps victims and bystanders to take action against domestic violence.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L3: Communication targets protection of vulnerable populations
Measure_L4: Campaign for mental health during covid-19 crisis
Comment: Today the government campaign aimed at mental complaints during the corona crisis has started. With the message: 'Gloomy or tense by the corona virus? Talk about it 'draws attention to the psychological consequences of the corona outbreak. Practical tips are given on the radio and on social media and people are invited to talk about it or seek help if necessary. State Secretary Paul Blokhuis (VWS) wants to use the campaign to help people get through this period mentally as well as possible
Outdoor sports are now possible for children again.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support tourism, sport and culture sectors
Comment: With the reopening of sport for young people, the Cabinet is making an extra 110 million euros available for sports associations. Sports associations are also financially affected by the measures to contain the corona virus. Competitions have ended prematurely and clubhouses have closed. On the proposal of Minister Van Rijn for Medical Care, the Council of Ministers has agreed to come to the aid of the clubs so that they can receive the youth well and the unique Dutch infrastructure is preserved. With the idea that sports clubs will soon be able to open their doors again for all Dutch people.

Comment: Repatriation flight with Dutch and other Europeans from Sint Maarten (incl. Travelers from Saba and Sint Eustatius)

If the visiting arrangement works well in practice, it is the intention that as of 25 May limited visits can be made in more nursing home locations. Nursing homes can only qualify if they are in any case free from contamination. It is also important for participation that the client council, works council, nursing advisory council, professional advisory council, the management and the geriatric specialist of the location in question have agreed. Conditions are also set, among other things, with regard to hygiene, protective equipment and staffing. In addition, it is important that one and a half meters can be kept when visiting. Ultimately, the director of Public Health of the relevant GGD region decides which nursing home can start with the adjusted visit arrangement

Measure_L3: To support law enforcement/sanction in case of no compliance
Comment: New Zealand Police are dealing with people who are not complying with the rules for Alert Level 4. The first response will be to educate and support them to follow the rules. This means returning home to self-isolation. The vast majority of people are following the rules, but non-compliance will be enforced by Police. The maximum penalty is six months imprisonment and/or a $4,000 fine. If you'd like to report a breach head to: http://105.police.govt.nz

Comment: On the subject of tertiary education, Ardern announced a new raft of measures to support those in trades and training. An immediate package of support for students will include increased course-related costs from $1000 to $2000 for full-time students. student support allowances and loans will continue for students unable to study online for up to eight weeks. where students receive partial refunds in 2020 because their course has been discontinued due to Covid-19, this will not affect future entitlements. and where students are unable to complete a course of study in 2020, this will not affect their entitlement to fees-free study.

Measure_L4: Covid-related pay cut of some ministers

We will be at Alert Level 3 for two weeks before Cabinet will decide our next steps. The Government will continue to provide financial support and assistance
