At today's 27th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia supplemented the Decision on Prohibition and Special Traffic Regime on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia with a ban on entry and exit from and in the territory of the Municipality of Kumanovo with city and intercity passenger and railway passenger public transport --- The Government of North Macedonia decided during today’s meeting to suspend long-distance and urban travelling to and from the Municipality of Kumanovo and to recommend that all shops in semi-open areas which are not malls to remain closed.

Measure_L4: Increase technical capacity for performing tests
Comment: With this decision, the Ministry of Health and the Institute of Public Health are obliged to prepare a special plan with teams to take all necessary measures and activities to conduct a number of tests in the area of ??the municipality of Kumanovo, for continuous detection and organization. to monitor the situation with the number of infected people from Koronavirus (COVID-19), for more efficient treatment of the same, as well as to send professional medical staff and to provide technical assistance for the needs of the General Hospital - Kumanovo.

Measure_L4: Extend national curfew to weekend in this area
Comment: At today's 34th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia made a decision to ban and a special regime of the population movement (police hour) in the Municipality of Kumanovo, a complete ban during the weekend, starting at 21:00 on Friday (today ) until 05:00 on Monday (06.04.2020). Exceptions to the ban on movement apply to the police, the army, health workers (in PHI and PHI, as well as family doctors) who will carry out their work engagements without interruption

Starting from April 22, 2020 (Wednesday), a measure is introduced to ban the movement of the population in the municipalities of Kumanovo, Tetovo and Prilep, without wearing appropriate protective equipment (mask, scarf, shawl, etc.) outside their homes. , in all public places and areas of open and closed type, as well as closed premises, markets, shops or similar

At today's 55th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia accepted the proposal of the General Coordination Headquarters, based on the opinion of the Commission for Infectious Diseases, for normalization of public urban and intercity public transport to and from the Municipality of Kumanovo

Region: Municipalities of Debar and Centar Zupa
Comment: Adopted a Decision on Prohibition and a special regime of movement on part of the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia on the territories of the municipalities of Debar and Centar Zupa, which regulates the measure banning movement, ie entry and exit from the municipalities of Debar and Centar Zupa, as well as a measure to introduce a special regime of movement of the population within these areas.
Every day, Monday to Sunday, citizens can move freely between 05:00 and 19:00hrs. Citizens 67 and older can move freely every day between 05:00 and 12:00

Every day, Monday to Sunday, citizens can move freely between 05:00 and 19:00hrs. Citizens 67 and older can move freely every day between 05:00 and 12:00. People 18 and younger can move freely every day between 13:00 and 19:00

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: it was decided that the Ministry of Health will establish a permanent information center for the public, which will include the Border Police, the Crisis Management Center and the Public Relations Department of the Government. This center will establish close cooperation with the media in the country, and will aim to gather all relevant information and in order to timely, accurately and adequately inform the public about the prevention and protection of the population from the spread of the corona virus, as well as procedures and the institutional framework for treating the effects of the virus

Comment: The Ministry of Health should also urgently procure an adequate amount of soap and disinfectants for schools, kindergartens and public toilets

The government has decided to oblige all primary and secondary schools, as well as all universities, to postpone all planned trips and excursions to Italy, as well as to organize educational hours for corona virus prevention, in cooperation with the local government and public health centers

The government recommends that the organizers of sports events, the matches within the set period, be played without spectators until March 6. The same government recommendation applies to all other major entertainment and cultural and artistic events

To stop the work of the libraries, the student dormitories and the student dormitories on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, in the next 14 days, and the employees in these institutions to be fired during this period

The catering facilities, cafes, bars, restaurants, clubs, casinos and sports betting shops should work part-time, from 7.00 am to 6 pm.00 o'clock, with half the capacity for guests, ie to keep the minimum necessary distance of at least one meter and a half to two meters between the people staying in these facilities

To close for visitors all stores in malls on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, except supermarkets, grocery stores and pharmacies. All other legal entities can work and sell in an alternative way (via online orders, telephone orders, etc.) and deliver orders

It is forbidden to visit all extracurricular activities and other private activities that children perform outside the classroom (visiting educational activities, courses, additional classes, sports trainings, etc.).
The use of any type of swimming pools on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia is prohibited.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The Ministry of Health obliges every citizen of ours who enters the border crossings in the Republic of Northern Macedonia, and travels from high risk or medium risk countries, at the entrance, to issue a written order to the border crossing for mandatory self-isolation and to sign it in writing. a statement under full moral, material and criminal responsibility that he will carry out self-isolation in which he will list his personal generals, with data on the address and place of residence during self-isolation.
The Government of North Macedonia closes the two international airports (Skopje and Ohrid)

Ban foreigners from entering the country

Comment: The Ministry of Interior is obliged to intensify the controls and checks of the persons who are directed to conduct self-isolation and to respect the measures of the Government and to inform the Government on a daily basis

Comment: To appeal to the citizens of the Republic of Northern Macedonia not to travel abroad.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L4: Transport of goods through medium and high-risk countries
Comment: To persons traveling through the countries with medium and high risk of COVID-19, who drive heavy goods vehicles for the transport of foodstuffs and other goods, during their transit transport and stay, loading or unloading of goods in these countries, they are advised to follow the following measures for personal and collective protection: restricted from contacts and movements on the roads from point A to point B, except for the need to provide food and toilet, Contact with other people is prohibited, If they go out to buy food or a toilet, be sure to use personal protective equipment, such as disposable gloves, protective masks N 95 or FFR 3 with a single filter, recommended to sleep in the cabins of their motor vehicles, After every contact in the market, store, toilet, hand disinfection is mandatory

Measure_L4: Facilitate loans for entrepreneurs and businesses
Comment: That is, one of the measures is the introduction of a new credit line of 5 million euros, which will directly lend to companies whose economic activity is directly affected by the coronavirus. Lending will be done on more favorable terms - longer grace periods, longer repayment period and lower interest rates than standard loans. The loans will be in the amount of EUR 5,000 to EUR 20,000, and the amount will depend on the number of employees in the company,

The Development Bank of the Republic of Northern Macedonia plans to directly lend to companies affected by the coronavirus in the amount of additional 6 million euros from the Compensation Fund from foreign aid and the Compensation Fund from other foreign aid, and it is necessary to provide conditions for operationalization of these funds
The Republic of North Macedonia has been in a state of emergency since 19th March 2020.

It is forbidden to gather in a group of more than five people, in parks and other public places and public areas.

It is recommended to all employers in the Republic of Northern Macedonia, ie each managing director of the institution, depending on the type of work and opportunities to organize the work and the way of working of the employees, through work from home, without disturbing the regular and normal functioning of the institution. Exceptions to this measure are employees of the Ministry of Interior, the Ministry of Health, the Ministry of Defense, the Army of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, fire territorial units, the Customs Administration, as well as nursing homes and small group homes

postponement of the exam for experts, the bar exam, the exam for mediators and the exam for notaries during the state of emergency. Measure_L2: The government provide assistance to vulnerable populations
Measure_L3: Packages for personal hygiene and disinfection for low-income families
Comment: The Ministry of Labor and Social Policy informs that the distribution of packages with means of personal hygiene and disinfection for the families living in substandard conditions is in progress. Hygienic packages will help those most in need of easier home remedies to avoid infection. In recent days, teams from the Centers for Social Work in Probistip, Tetovo, Skopje, Resen, Vinica, Sveti Nikole, Krushevo, Gostivar, Kriva Palanka, Valandovo and Kumanovo have distributed packages to over 400 families living in substandard conditions. In the following days, the action continues in other centers

Measure_L4: Press conferences online, no journalist or cameraman
Comment: from today (March 20, 2020) government press conferences will be held exclusively through online streaming, without the presence of journalists and cameramen in the media center of the Government. The purpose of these measures is to jointly protect and provide working conditions in accordance with the current situation

Today, the Minister of Agriculture, Forestry and Water Economy Trajan Dimkovski, held a press conference regarding the spread of the corona virus in our country and the recommendations for farmers in case of emergency

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Comment: At today's session of the Government, it decided to freeze the prices of lemon, orange, tangerine and grapefruit and clementines, and determined that the highest trade margin of these products will be the one that was applied until March 11, 2020 when the World Health Organization (WHO) has declared a coronavirus pandemic

The government has decided to extend the validity of driver's licenses that have expired during the state of emergency, and all procedural actions to conduct trainings to train a candidate driver in driving schools and to conduct a driving test of the candidate for driver in the examination centers, as well as the deadlines for the validity of the documents that are determined by law for conducting the trainings, ie the exams, to be interrupted, ie to be suspended during the state of emergency
To organize intercity and public transport by limiting the capacity for passenger transport by 50% in the vehicle, or by mandatory maintenance of a distance of at least two meters between passengers

At this session, the Government adopted an Decree with legal force to determine the tasks of the Army of the Republic of Northern Macedonia during the state of emergency, which determines the tasks of the Army of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, to support the police forces of the Ministry of Interior and to support the units of local self-government, the bodies of the state administration or other state institutions of the Republic of Northern Macedonia during the state of emergency, in order to prevent the entry, expansion and coronavirus COVID treatment 19.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: For patients with COVID-19 coronavirus infection, the treatment is subject to strict isolation (quarantine) at home or in a health facility, which is decided by a healthcare professional after assessing the severity of the clinical picture

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: A person who has been or is suspected to be in direct contact with a person infected with or infected with coronavirus COVID-19 applies the 14-day strict isolation (quarantine) measure at home (domestic isolation), for which the person signs a written statement under full moral, material and criminal responsibility that it will respect the measure, and the State Sanitary and Health Inspectorate makes a decision.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: A person who enters the border crossings in the Republic of Northern Macedonia and travels from high, medium or low risk countries determined in accordance with the List of the World Health Organization, is determined the measure of strict isolation (quarantine) for 14 days, in the facilities referred to in paragraph 3 of this article

With the entry into force of this Decree, all election activities for conducting the elections for Members of the Assembly of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, which are scheduled for April 12, 2020, shall be terminated. The conduct of the election activities will continue from the day of the cessation of the state of emergency. All election activities that have been undertaken in accordance with the provisions of the Electoral Code until the day of entry into force of this Decree shall be considered valid
Additionally, the movement of persons in the Republic of Northern Macedonia aged 67 years is prohibited, in the period from 11:00 to 6:00 the next day.

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Measure_L4: Consumable medical supplies and medical equipment and appliances
Comment: At this session, the Government adopted a Decision on amending and supplementing the Decision on determining the highest prices of certain products in wholesale and retail trade: According to this Decision on determining the highest prices of certain products in wholesale and retail trade ("Official Gazette of the Republic of Northern Macedonia" No. 70 of 19.03.2020), in Article 1 of this Decision on the words "and disinfectants" ”Is supplemented with the words“ consumable medical supplies and medical equipment and appliances ”

Measure_L4: For primary schools, high schools, universities
Comment: According to the provisions of this decree, with legal force, the teaching in the primary schools is organized through distance learning, ie learning from home, by applying the means for electronic communication.

Measure_L3: Return operation of nationals living abroad
Comment: organizing air transport of Macedonian citizens with current residence abroad on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia during the state of emergency

Measure_L4: Increase domestic production of face masks
Comment: The Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia will conduct interventional procurement of at least 2000 protective masks per day for the needs of the Republic of Northern Macedonia from domestic producers

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: At this session, the Government adopted the Decree with legal force for application of the Law on Personal Income Tax during the State of Emergency. The Decree on the Legal Force for the Application of the Law on Personal Income Tax during a State of Emergency is proposed as a measure to support taxpayers of personal income tax who earn income from self-employment and who have suffered damages in their work due to the spread of coronavirus. COVID-19, to be exempt from paying the amount of personal income tax advance payments for the months of March, April and May 2020

This decree was adopted due to the declared state of emergency in the country, which requires the engagement of the entire capacity of organizational units within the Ministry, including police officers - trainees, and therefore proposes this decree with legal force, which extends the length of service of a police officer - a trainee (determined in Article 102 of the Law) is shortened from six to five months. In this way, an additional number of police officers will be provided, in accordance with the needs, dynamics, obligations and tasks of the police, for the implementation of decisions, recommendations, conclusions and measures determined by the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia

At today's session, the Minister of Education and Science Arber Ademi informed about the installation of the National Platform for e-teaching which will be used in the educational process during the state of emergency from today, and that they are working on a solution for students who do not have internet access

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: At this session, the Government adopted the Decree with legal force for application of the Law on Value Added Tax during the state of emergency, by which taxpayers have the opportunity to issue invoices, in addition to paper, in electronic form. This is in order to facilitate the work of taxpayers, as well as to prevent the use of paper in order to reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus COVID-19

Measure_L4: Extend testing capacity to private institutions
Comment: With the amendment of the Decree, it is possible to perform the service for detection of coronavirus COVID-19 in the microbiological laboratory in the network of health institutions during the state of emergency and from private health institutions that are not in the network of health institutions, in order to increase of the capacities for providing such services, in conditions of the adopted Decision for determining the existence of a state of emergency.

Measure_L4: Student dormitories repurposed into quarantine facilities
Comment: Having in mind the declared state of emergency in the country, these regulations regulate the enabling of dormitories with legal force, as well as the amendments to the Program for student standards, enabling the dormitories to be used as accommodation facilities for prevention of spread. of the coronavirus (COVID 19
Judges-jurors whose mandate expires during the state of emergency, by virtue of this Decree, their mandate is extended until the end of the court proceedings.

Measure_L3: Mobilization of domestic resources for health
Measure_L4: Prioritize employment in the health sector
Comment: In the public sector, new employments, new engagements through temporary employment agencies and new work contracts are temporarily prohibited, except for hiring appropriate staff in the health sector and in other sectors that are aimed at dealing with the consequences of coronavirus

At the proposal of the Ministry of Transport and Communications, the session adopted a Decree with legal force for the application of the Law on Road Transport, according to which the exam for professional competence of a person responsible for transport and the exam for professional competence of a driver for Participation in international road traffic is delayed during the duration of the state of emergency, and with which the validity of driver's professional competence certificates for participation in international road traffic whose validity period is expiring etc., are extended for the duration of the emergency

Measure_L2: Increase in medical supplies and equipment
Comment: The Government considered and adopted the Decree on Emergency Procurement of Respiratory Machines during the State of Emergency, which regulates the conditions and procedure for interventional procurement of 200 respiratory machines for the implementation of the measures for dealing with coronavirus COVID-19 during the emergency , in accordance with the specification regulated by the Decree with legal force. For this procurement, the Ministry of Health will publish a public call on its website, which will last 72 hours from the moment of its publication

At the proposal of the Commission for Infectious Diseases within the Ministry of Health and the General Crisis Staff, today was adopted an amendment to the Decision to ban the movement of citizens throughout the country, ie to extend the curfew on the entire territory of Northern Macedonia

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: Within the 36th session, today, an Decree was adopted with legal force for application of the Law on Health Insurance during the state of emergency according to which the insured persons whose rights from the compulsory health insurance are denied due to irregularly paid contribution or payment of the contribution may be more than 60 days late, ie have a debt for unpaid contributions, may use health services in healthcare facilities related to the diagnosis and treatment of coronavirus KOVID-19 at the expense of the funds of Health Insurance Fund of the Republic of Northern Macedonia. This Decree for treatment by KOVID-19 at the expense of the Fund, also applies to the citizens of the Republic of Northern Macedonia who are not necessarily health insured on any grounds

agreement between the Republic of Northern Macedonia and the Republic of Turkey for donation of medical equipment and funds for the health sector consisting of 50,000 pieces of protective medical masks, 1000 protective spacesuits and 1000 diagnostic tests

The use of this mobile application is on a voluntary basis by the citizens of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, and the details of the application will be presented at a press conference by the Minister of Health and the Minister of Information Society and Administration

Measure_L2: The government provide assistance to vulnerable populations
Comment: The government reviewed the information and adopted the text of the agreement for donation of mobile internet cards to socially disadvantaged families who have children-students in primary and secondary school. For that purpose, the Ministry of Information Society and Administration and Makedonski Telekom AD Skopje signed an agreement for donation of mobile internet cards, which will provide 18,400 mobile internet cards with a capacity of 10 GB per month intended to provide access to learning platforms. , in accordance with the guidelines and measures determined at the proposal of the Ministry of Education and Science. The purpose of this donation is to provide technical funds for the end of the school year to all students from primary and secondary schools, by providing cards for mobile internet

At today's 39th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia adopted the Decision on redistribution of funds between budget users of the central government and between the funds, according to which in the Budget of the Republic of Northern Macedonia for 2020, in the special part in the first sub-column Basic budget, redistribution of funds in the amount of 6,542,000,000 denars

At today's Government session, an Decree was adopted with the legal force for borrowing of the Republic of Northern Macedonia from the International Monetary Fund for financial support from the Instrument for Rapid Financing during the State of Emergency. The financial support from the International Monetary Fund of about 176.7 million euros through this instrument, the Republic of Northern Macedonia will use for budget needs in financing the measures for health and macroeconomic stabilization and meeting the needs of the balance of payments arising from the emergence of KOVID- 19.

Measure_L4: Termination of employment contracts of healthcare workers postponed
Comment: At the proposal of the Ministry of Health, today the Government adopted the Decree amending the Decree with legal force for application of the Law on Health Care during the state of emergency, which regulates the termination of employment by force of law, with termination of the Employment Agreement. or the Agreement for extension of the employment of a healthcare worker or healthcare associate, due to age, is postponed during the duration of the state of emergency, in case of acquiring the right to old-age pension, when it is full and 64 years for men and 62 for a woman under the Law on pension and disability insurance for times of emergency, or when he turns 64,that is, when with a written statement to the employer he requested that his employment contract be extended for a maximum of 67 years in accordance with the Law on Labor Relations. According to this Decree, the initiated procedures for termination of the employment contract or contract for extension of the employment of a healthcare worker, ie the healthcare associate, due to age, are postponed during the duration of the state of emergency.

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: Due to the epidemic, the deadline for payment of the annual rent for 2019 is extended until October 31, 2020, and unilateral termination of contracts for lease of agricultural land will not be performed. in state ownership due to unpaid annual rent until October 31, 2020

Comment: At this session it was decided to recommend to all employees in the state administration bodies, public enterprises established by the state, joint stock companies in state ownership, agencies, funds, bureaus, offices, administrations and all other state institutions, as well as indicated to the units of local self-government, public enterprises and other legal entities established by the units of local self-government, as well as to the employees of the private sector to download (install) the mobile application "Stop Corona!". For this purpose, the Health Insurance Fund of the Republic of Northern Macedonia is instructed to oblige all family doctors on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia to recommend to their patients to download (install) the mobile application "Stop Corona!"

The Decision stipulates that every domestic or foreign natural person on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia is obliged to wear personal protective equipment when leaving the home, ie when moving in public places and areas of open and closed type, in markets, in public transport and when entering closed spaces where several people gather (state institutions, markets, shops, banks, post offices, waiting rooms, health institutions, etc.).Personal protective equipment includes any form of protection that covers the nose and mouth (FFP2 or higher standard respirator, disposable surgical mask, reusable textile mask, silk scarf or shawl, cotton scarf or shawl, bandana and the like).

The Decision stipulates that every domestic or foreign natural person on the territory of the Republic of Northern Macedonia is obliged to wear personal protective equipment when leaving the home, ie when moving in public places and areas of open and closed type, in markets, in public transport and when entering closed spaces where several people gather (state institutions, markets, shops, banks, post offices, waiting rooms, health institutions, etc.).Personal protective equipment includes any form of protection that covers the nose and mouth (FFP2 or higher standard respirator, disposable surgical mask, reusable textile mask, silk scarf or shawl, cotton scarf or shawl, bandana and the like).

Measure_L4: In shops, buisinesses, and public institutions
Comment: The decree also stipulates that all citizens on the territory of Northern Macedonia are obliged in their headquarters, subsidiaries and facilities in which they perform their activity, to ensure the wearing of personal protective equipment on the nose and mouth by all natural persons working and to prohibit entry and movement through these premises of any natural person who enters as a visitor in these premises, and who will not wear personal protective equipment.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L4: All tested for Covid-19 until the test results
Comment: Today, an Decree was adopted with legal force for mandatory self-isolation during testing for the presence of coronavirus KOVID-19. According to this decree, all domestic and foreign natural persons, symptomatic and asymptomatic, who have been tested for the presence of coronavirus KOVID-19 in their body, are placed in mandatory self-isolation from the moment of taking the test material (swab from mouth, throat swab, nasal swab, blood, etc.), until a negative result is obtained.

At today's 45th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia adopted decisions related to dealing with the coronavirus that are valid from tomorrow, Thursday, April 23, and refer to the reduction of movement restrictions and increase for the protection of citizens. According to these decisions, every working day, from Monday to Friday, the movement of citizens will be allowed from 05:00 in the morning until 19:00. The ban on movement from Monday to Friday throughout the country will start at 19:00 and will last until 05:00 in the morning. For persons over 67 years of age, movement will be allowed every working day from 05:00 in the morning until 12:00 at noon. Young people up to the age of 18 will be able to go out from Monday to Friday from 13:00 to 19:00

Measure_L4: Increased allowed time out of home
Comment: At today's 45th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia adopted decisions related to dealing with the coronavirus that are valid from tomorrow, Thursday, April 23, and refer to the reduction of movement restrictions and increase for the protection of citizens. According to these decisions, every working day, from Monday to Friday, the movement of citizens will be allowed from 05:00 in the morning until 19:00. The ban on movement from Monday to Friday throughout the country will start at 19:00 and will last until 05:00 in the morning. For persons over 67 years of age, movement will be allowed every working day from 05:00 in the morning until 12:00 at noon. Young people up to the age of 18 will be able to go out from Monday to Friday from 13:00 to 19:00

Measure_L4: Games of chance can operate online
Comment: The decree allows economic operators who organize games of chance to continue their activities online (via the Internet), which creates conditions to save 7,500 jobs in this activity

Today, the Government adopted the Information on Realization of Funds from the Project for Connection of Local Roads Funded by the World Bank, in the amount of EUR 50 million, in order to co-finance the government measure for financial support of employers affected by the health and economic crisis for payment of salaries of workers for the months of April and May 2020

At today's 48th session, the Government of the Republic of Northern Macedonia reviewed and adopted the information with a package of measures in the field of education related to the implementation of the educational process in conditions of COMMUN-19 crisis, at the proposal of the Ministry of Education and Science (MES). The first measure refers to the teaching in primary and secondary schools, which is determined to be organized through distance learning, ie learning from home, by applying electronic communication means, until June 10, 2020

Additionally, during the next few days, a Draft-Decree with legal force will be defined for the release of the students from the final years in the academic year 2019/2020 from taking the graduation exam

The Government accepted the harmonized text of the Donation Protocol and the Annex to the Protocol between the Ministry of Defense of the Republic of Northern Macedonia and the Ministry of Defense of the Kingdom of Norway and authorized the Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defense Radmila Sekerinska to sign the protocol. ROLE 2 MTF Hospital of the Army of the Republic of Northern Macedonia, which has been put into operational use as part of the Clinic for Infectious Diseases in the Clinical Center Skopje, includes financial means EUR 200,000 for medical supplies

At today's session, at the proposal of the Ministry of Interior, regulations were adopted with legal force for travel documents and driver's licenses of citizens of the Republic of Northern Macedonia during the state of emergency, which extend the term of these personal documents until July 31, 2020. year

Also, starting tomorrow, it will be possible to start teaching and conducting trainings and exams in the examination centers by the driver training schools in accordance with the protocol for these activities

This first package of "relaxations" of the measures envisages the start of outdoor sports training, exclusively for individual sports and tennis, as well as the work of sports and other bookmakers over the counter, again in accordance with the protocol of the Commission for Infectious Diseases at the Ministry of Health

In accordance with the epidemiological situation in the country and the decision of the Commission for Infectious Diseases, the Government decided to allow the opening of closed shopping malls - moths, with strict rules and protocols for their work in the implementation of prevention measures to prevent the occurrence and spread of COVID-19

Measure_L4: Payment card to stimulate consumption of domestic products and services
Comment: Today I am announcing the third package of economic measures that the Government has just established. If the first two sets of measures mitigated the impact of the health crisis on the economy, we are now one step further. The third set of economic measures concerns revitalization, economic recovery and stimulation of consumption and industry. These are targeted measures, direct assistance from the state and the citizens and the economy. All categories and socially vulnerable groups of citizens and businesses are supported. It is about direct financial support for increasing consumption, direct support to the economy, agriculture, a reward for doctors and the medical staff of infectious disease clinics and departments. The value of the measures from the third package is 355 million euros and will cover 730,000 users. With this package, the total economic assistance from the three sets of measures is 550 million euros or 5.5% of GDP. Therefore, in the first pillar of the new package, as direct financial support for citizens in order to stimulate consumption with a focus on domestic products and services and affected sectors, we introduce payment cards for citizens - for greater consumption and development of domestic economic activities: First of all, about 100 thousand citizens of our country will receive a payment card worth 9,000 denars for Macedonian products and services. This measure is available to all unemployed people, job seekers who do not have over 15,000 monthly income, as well as recipients of guaranteed minimum wage

Measure_L3: Direct support to people with low income
Comment: Also, about 100 thousand of our citizens will receive a voucher for domestic tourism of 6,000 denars and a home payment card of 3,000 denars. This measure covers all employed citizens who receive a net salary of less than 15,000 denars per month and have no other income

Measure_L4: Vouchers for IT and digital skills training
Comment: The following is the measure of financial support for young people up to 6,000 denars, payment card of 3,000 denars and co-financing vouchers for IT and digital skills training. This is a strong support for young people, to continue the educational process smoothly and to provide purchasing power, as a contribution to the student and student standard. The measure includes vouchers of up to 6,000 denars to cover tuition fees at the University or for accommodation in student dormitories and registered accommodation facilities for students and high school students coming from low-income families. The measure also includes a payment card for young people, worth 3,000 denars for domestic products and services. We also introduce vouchers up to 30,000 denars for co-financing trainings, trainings and courses for IT and digital skills for young people. By covering the costs of training and coaching, we support young people to gain knowledge and skills in information technology that will enable them to quickly find employment in the new development economy. This measure will cover 100 thousand young fellow citizens, worth 12 million euros

We are introducing a VAT-free weekend for all citizens: Through cheaper prices for citizens, we encourage consumption and revenue growth in certain sales sectors, such as clothing stores, white goods, furniture, sanitation, school supplies and books

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Government supports the obtention of unemployment benefits
Comment: Remuneration for all persons who lost their jobs from March 11 to April 30, 2020: With this measure, we provide the opportunity for monetary compensation to all persons who have lost their jobs, including those who have terminated their employment through a written statement, by agreement, or have been fired by the employer.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Facilitate loans for companies to support for women, youth and digitalization in business
Comment: Interest-free loans for companies through the Development Bank of Northern Macedonia, worth 31 million euros - support for women, youth and digitalization in business. This interest-free credit line worth 31 million euros will be available to all micro and small companies and it will also offer a 30% grant (non-refundable) for those companies that are run or founded by women or employ young people, are export-oriented or introduce innovation and digitalization in their operations

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Facilitate loans for start-ups and small and micro companies
Comment: State guarantee for commercial loans and for securing the customs debt. The state makes available financial support to support start-ups and small and micro companies through commercial banks with 10 million euros initial capital for easier access to financial resources to support the private sector, by taking part of the credit risk. support and take part of the risk for commercial credit. + New 25 million euros for the private sector - for new markets, competitiveness and modernization. According to the law on financial support with 25 million euros, through the program to strengthen the competitiveness of the industry, we help companies to conquer new markets, increase their competitiveness and modernize processes

Based on the assessments, based on the talks and of course the need, we decided to award a cash prize to all health and non-health workers who were involved and are still involved in working with patients with coronavirus in our country, doctors, nurses, but also unhealthy workers - paramedics, transporters, drivers in the emergency medical service will receive a reward of 20% of the basic salary for two months in all public health institutions, hospitals, institutes where the examinations were performed, dravstvenite homes who organized transport etc.

Starting from April 22, 2020 (Wednesday), a measure is introduced to ban the movement of the population in the municipalities of Kumanovo, Tetovo and Prilep, without wearing appropriate protective equipment (mask, scarf, shawl, etc.) outside their homes. , in all public places and areas of open and closed type, as well as closed premises, markets, shops or similar

Starting from April 22, 2020 (Wednesday), a measure is introduced to ban the movement of the population in the municipalities of Kumanovo, Tetovo and Prilep, without wearing appropriate protective equipment (mask, scarf, shawl, etc.) outside their homes. , in all public places and areas of open and closed type, as well as closed premises, markets, shops or similar

Starting from April 22, 2020 (Wednesday), a measure is introduced to ban the movement of the population in the municipalities of Kumanovo, Tetovo and Prilep, without wearing appropriate protective equipment (mask, scarf, shawl, etc.) outside their homes. , in all public places and areas of open and closed type, as well as closed premises, markets, shops or similar

Starting from April 22, 2020 (Wednesday), a measure is introduced to ban the movement of the population in the municipalities of Kumanovo, Tetovo and Prilep, without wearing appropriate protective equipment (mask, scarf, shawl, etc.) outside their homes. , in all public places and areas of open and closed type, as well as closed premises, markets, shops or similar

Measure_L4: Funds to  WHO for humanitarian efforts and to the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations for vaccine development.
Comment: Norway is supporting the urgent global response to the outbreak of coronavirus, covid-19, and is providing NOK 10 million to the World Health Organization (WHO) for humanitarian efforts and NOK 36 million to the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (CEPI) for vaccine development. Norway is also working hard to encourage other countries to step up their support.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The first cases of the coronavirus has been confirmed in Norway. The Norwegian health authorities are monitoring the situation closely and are prepared for more cases. The Norwegian health authorities are prepared for the coronavirus, and have already put several measures into action. Those who have tested positive are healthy, but they are in daily contact with health care personnel. It is important that everyone do what they can to limit the risk of infection by following the official advice for hygiene: Wash your hands regularly and cough into paper or your elbow, says Minister of Health and Care Services Bent Hoie.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Measure_L4: Advice campaign for sneezing/coughing in the elbow
Comment: The first cases of the coronavirus has been confirmed in Norway. The Norwegian health authorities are monitoring the situation closely and are prepared for more cases. The Norwegian health authorities are prepared for the coronavirus, and have already put several measures into action. Those who have tested positive are healthy, but they are in daily contact with health care personnel.I am following the situation closely, and I am also receiving frequent updates from the Norwegian Directorate of Health and the Norwegian Institute of Public Health. It is important that everyone do what they can to limit the risk of infection by following the official advice for hygiene: Wash your hands regularly and cough into paper or your elbow, says Minister of Health and Care Services Bent Hoie.

Measure_L3: Complete closure of primary and secondary schools

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Incouraging to avoid public places

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Discouraging all the leisure travels

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Discouraging travelling to work
Healthcare professionals working with patient care were prohibited from travelling abroad. The ban applied to both business travel and private travel.

Measure_L3: Measures to limit contact to long-term care facilities
Measure_L4: Recommendation to reduce contact to long-term care facilities
Visit restriction in prisons and youth detention centers
Comment: Recommendations to reduce contacts with people in prison

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Every place serving food has to respect the 1m distance

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Encouraging to avoid close contact with others

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Discouraging the use of public transport

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L4: People who travelled out of Nordic countries
Comment: Everyone who comes from outside the Nordic countries should be in quarantine for 14 days from their arrival in Norway, regardless of whether they have symptoms or not. Retroactive from 27 February.
Closure of all establishments in the hospitality industry such as bars, pubs and clubs other than those serving food

As of 13 March, Norway introduced a ban on visits to Norway through Oslo airport. Norwegian and Nordic citizens, foreign residents in Norway and people continuing to another country are allowed anyway. Other people are dismissed and sent home as soon as possible and put in quarantine until then

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: Today, the Ministry of Finance has decided to follow Norges Bank’s advice to reduce the countercyclical capital buffer requirement from 2.5 to 1 percent with immediate effect. Norges Bank says that there is a risk of a pronounced economic downturn as a result of the coronavirus outbreak. The buffer requirement is reduced to prevent tighter lending standards from amplifying a downturn

Measure_L4: Hospitals prepared to treat Covid-19 patients
Comment: Measures in the health care system to handle the acute crisis :  securing necessary equipment and personnel.

Measure_L2: Increase in medical supplies and equipment
Measure_L3: Secure necessary medical equipment stocks and distribution
Comment: Measures in the health care system to handle the acute crisis :  securing necessary equipment and personal.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support companies to avoid massive lay-offs
Comment: Reduce the number of days that employers are obliged to pay salary to workers at temporary lay-offs, from 15 to 2 days. This will be a temporary measure to improve companies' liquidity and help avoid massive lay-offs.

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Government supports the obtention of unemployment benefits
Comment: Remove the three waiting days between the period when employers have to provide salary to workers in temporary layoffs and the period when the workers are entitled to daily unemployment benefits. This will reduce the loss of income for workers.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Partial or total deferral of tax payments for businesses
Comment: Change corporate tax regulations so that companies that are lossmaking can re-allocate their loss towards previous years’ taxed surplus.  Change the tax regulations so that owners of lossmaking companies can postpone payments of wealth tax. This will reduce the need for firms to provide dividends to owners to cover the wealth tax.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Suspend the tax on air passengers
Comment: Suspend the tax on air passengers for flights in the period from 1 January 2020 until 31 October 2020.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Strengthen support for skills upgrade and in-house training
Comment: Strengthen support for skills upgrade and in-house training for companies affected by the virus outbreak, through increased grants to the counties.
Increase allocation to municipalities that will have large excess expenses due to the virus outbreak.

Measure_L4: Ensure pension rights for mobilized retired healthcare professionals
Comment: Make sure that pension rights are not affected negatively for retired health personnel that returns to service in connection with the corona outbreak.

Measure_L3: Warning against travel to and return from high risk areas
Comment: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs advises against trips to the United States and France that are not strictly necessary

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs advises against all international travel that is not strictly necessary. The reason is the increasing spread of coronavirus internationally and the unpredictable and difficult situation faced by many travellers. For now, this advice will remain in effect until 14 April

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Expand child care access for essential persons
Comment: The following people in vital roles for ensuring security of food and fuel supply are to be offered day care and primary schooling for their children. 'This includes people who ensure that shops are sufficiently stocked with food and other essential items. We must make sure that these people are able to carry out their work. This is a matter of ensuring security of supply'

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: Persons who have been in close contact with someone who is confirmed to have contracted the SARS CoV-2 virus shall undergo quarantine for 14 days after contact. «Close contact» in this context refers to contact in closer proximity than two metres from other persons for more than 15 minutes, or direct physical contact. This does not apply to health personnel using proper protective equipment

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Facilitate loans for entrepreneurs and businesses
Comment: The government has proposed two new loan measures, providing support of a total of NOK 100 billion. The package will improve Norwegian businesses’ access to the necessary liquidity in the challenging situation they are now facing. 1. State loan guarantees for new loans to small and medium-sized enterprises. 2.The Government has further propose to reinstate the Government Bond Fund. This will contribute to increased liquidity and access to capital in the Norwegian bond market, where larger companies typically raise their funding

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: First press conference for children

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support tourism, sport and culture sectors
Comment: It is a very demanding time for the culture, voluntary and sport sectors, with businesses, organisations, clubs, associations and individuals seeing their income completely or partially disappear almost overnight'. The package presented today consists of a compensation scheme for cultural life which will amount to about NOK 300 million and a similar one for sport and voluntary sector activities of about NOK 600 million. The scheme is intended to compensate for loss of income from ticket sales and participation fees as well as additional expenses associated with events that have had to be cancelled or postponed due to the coronavirus.

Measure_L3: Prohibition of moving out the municipality of residence
Measure_L4: Ban on staying in cabins outside home municipality
Comment: As of 19 March, residents were prohibited from staying in cabins outside their home municipalities, in order to avoid putting strain on rural medical infrastructure. People suspected or confirmed to be infected must follow stricter home isolation rules. The government established fines for people violating home quarantine and home isolation rules or organizing events

Measure_L4: Law to ease the passing of laws
Comment: Storting (supreme legislatre in Norway) adopts Coronavirus Act. The Storting today adopted temporary legislation that will authorise the Government to carry out necessary and proportionate adaptive measures for a limited period to address the effects of the coronavirus (...) 'I am pleased that the Storting has been constructive in the work of preparing this act. Together, we have adopted a temporary law that will ensure we can implement necessary measures that we would otherwise have lacked the authority to implement,' the Minister of Justice and Public Security said

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: The Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs is working on an amendment to the Immigration Regulations to allow foreign workers already in Norway to receive a residence permit extension. This amendment is of great importance to agriculture

Measure_L4: UN fund to assist developing countries with weak health systems
Comment: Norway is taking the initiative to create a new multi-donor fund at the United Nations to assist developing countries with weak health systems in addressing the coronavirus crisis

The COVID-19 pandemic is affecting the nature and level of the risks facing Norwegian society. The Government is therefore strengthening Norway’s emergency preparedness capacity in order to respond to the current situation

The police are a crucial part of Norway’s emergency services, and in the time ahead, the police will play an important role in enforcing measures to prevent the spread of infection. An allocation of NOK 232 million has now been provided for the recruitment of up to 400 people to undertake active service with the police. The people recruited will have completed their police training, but are not currently working in the police. They will be employed for a period of six months, with the possibility of an extension to up to a year in total

Fast-track security clearance of personnel is becoming increasingly necessary because of the need for more people with police training and because many employees in other organisations that fulfil critical public functions are either in quarantine or on sick leave. In order to address this situation, the Government is providing an additional allocation of NOK 7 million to the Norwegian Civil Security Clearance Authority

We have seen that criminals and others are trying to exploit the COVID-19 crisis, for example to scam and defraud people. The Government is allocating NOK 5 million to the Norwegian National Security Authority (NSM) to strengthen the warning system for digital infrastructure by purchasing more sensors for use in critical sectors and organisations. Now that most of us are working from home, it is important for both companies and employees to be more vigilant with regard to cyber security,’ Ms Mæland said

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: The Government has therefore proposed an increase in funding of NOK 10 million to support the work of NGOs

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Support to foreign workers without social security
Comment: Svalbard and Longyearbyen are being severely affected by the current crisis. The Government is following the situation closely, and the Ministry of Justice and Public Security is maintaining close contact with the Governor of Svalbard and Longyearbyen Local Administration. On Friday 20 March, the Ministry of Justice and Public Security announced that it was working on a time-limited grant scheme for foreign workers in Longyearbyen who have been temporarily laid off but who are not covered by Norway’s social security and benefit schemes

Norway is to increase its support for the work to develop vaccines against the virus that has caused the current Covid-19 pandemic and against future epidemics by NOK 2.2 billion. The funding is being allocated to the Coalition for Epidemic Preparedness Innovations (Cepi), for its vaccine development work. Today’s decision to allocate a further NOK 2.2 billion to Cepi comes in addition to the allocations totalling NOK 1.636 billion that have previously been announced

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: mobile app that is being developed for contact tracing, in other words identifying people who have had close contact with infected patients. The digital solution for people to report their own symptoms, launched by the Norwegian Institute of Public Health, is to be further developed. And thirdly, funding will be provided for remote medical consultations and follow-up of patients at home using video communication

NOK 80 million allocated to three digitalisation initiatives. This allocation will be split between three initiatives. One is a mobile app that is being developed for contact tracing, in other words identifying people who have had close contact with infected patients. The digital solution for people to report their own symptoms, launched by the Norwegian Institute of Public Health, is to be further developed. And thirdly, funding will be provided for remote medical consultations and follow-up of patients at home using video communication

Measure_L4: Train personnel in intensive care medicine
Comment: NOK 40 million allocated for advanced simulation equipment. This will be used to train health care personnel in intensive care medicine, and increase the capacity of the health care system to train personnel to provide intensive care for critically ill patients

NOK 5 million for the expansion of Norway’s intensive care registry. The plan is to develop an intensive care and pandemic registry. Data from Norwegian hospitals in the intensive care registry will provide the basis for reports to the Norwegian Institute of Public Health and the Norwegian Directorate of Health as part of COVID-19 monitoring in Norway. The data can also be used to keep track of critical care capacity

Measure_L4: Develop digital guidelines software for hospitals and health care services
Comment: NOK 8 million has been allocated to update and distribute medical guidelines using the digital tool MAGIC. This tool makes it possible to update and distribute guidelines quickly to hospitals and municipal health and care services. The guidelines cover areas such as diagnosis, treatment of different patient groups and routines for infection prevention and control for health care personnel

Measure_L3: Prohibition of moving out the municipality of residence
Measure_L4: Ban on staying overnight at a holiday property in a municipality other than where they are registered as residing
Comment: Regulations relating to quarantine, isolation and prohibition against staying at holiday properties. Persons are prohibited from staying overnight at a holiday property in a municipality other than where they are registered as residing

Measure_L2: Increase in medical supplies and equipment
Comment: The Government is therefore guaranteeing project funding and has ordered 1 000 emergency respirators. The production of emergency ventilators in Norway is a collaboration between the Defence Research Establishment, Servi and Laerdal Medical

Norway to contribute to new UN Fund to fight Coronavirus. Norway is providing a first contribution of NOK 150 million to enable the work of the fund to get under way as soon as possible. 'We urge other countries to contribute too,' said Minister of Foreign Affairs. The fund is designed to complement the UN’s Global Humanitarian Response Plan and WHO’s Strategic Preparedness and Response Plan

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: Economic measures: A compensation scheme of NOK 1 billion to pre- and after school cares and day care

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Government supports the obtention of unemployment benefits
Comment: An extension of the unemployment benefit scheme by granting benefit from the first day and increasing the daily allowance. Temporary laid off persons are guaranteed 100 per cent compensation until a salary of 599 148 NOK. The sch. A temporary scheme to secure self-employed and freelancers who are not included in the unemployment benefit scheme and to give self-employed and freelancers sickness benefit from day fouremes for temporary laid off and unemployed are also adjusted to include more people. Temporary benefit for apprentices in case of unemployment or temporary layoff.

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Support skills development for unemployed and laid-off persons
Comment: Skills development measures to improve the skills of unemployed and laid-off persons

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Comment: Increase access to loans for students who have lost work income. NOK 1 billion is allocated to convert some of that supplement loan into a grant

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Suspension of parents' pay for  daycare centres during the period they are closed
Comment: Suspension of parents’ pay for pre- and after school cares and day cares during the period they are closed

Prime Minister Erna Solberg’s introductory remarks at a press conference to announce an easing of restrictions in Norway’s coronavirus measures, Tuesday 7 April. 'Everyone has seen the pictures and read the horror stories from other European countries where the health care system has collapsed'. (...) From 20 April, we will open the country’s day-care centres (...) Those who can work from home must continue to do so. We must still be conscientious about following the rules on social distancing. We must wash our hands just as often, cough into our elbows and take all hygienic and infection control measures seriously. Anyone experiencing symptoms must stay at home. Quarantine and isolation rules must be respected as scrupulously as before.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: The Government has decided to change the regulations on rejecting foreign nationals without a residence permit at the border, thus enabling a greater number of European Economic Area (EEA) nationals who are to work in Norway to enter the country

Measure_L4: International Committee of the Red Cross and International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
Comment: The Government is allocating NOK 30 million to the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) and the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies (IFRC) for their humanitarian response to the Covid-19 pandemic

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Second press conference for children

Measure_L4: Covid-19 test-kits to most vulnerable countries
Comment: Norway contributes NOK 22,5 million to Covid-19 test-kits provided by The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA).'I am pleased that IAEA is prioritizing the distribution of test-kits so that they reach the vulnerable countries that need it the most'
Starting 20 April, health practitioners who perform one-to-one services, such as psychologists, opticians and physiotherapists, will be able to resume much of their activity

Measure_L4: Allow to go to secondary residence
Comment: Starting 20 April, it will also be possible for people to stay overnight at their holiday cabins. The recommendation to limit unnecessary leisure travel remains in effect. We must continue to restrict our movement patterns in order to keep COVID-19 from flaring up again

Measure_L3: Re-opening of primary schools and child care
Comment: From 27 April, pupils in primary school years 1–4 will go back to school and to out-of-school care programmes

Starting 27 April, we will re-open upper secondary school for second- and third-year pupils who are following vocational programmes, provided that this can be done in a way that meets infection control guidelines

Measure_L4: Hairdressers, massage and skin care professionals
Comment: By 27 April at the latest, we will allow services where there is one-to-one contact, such as hairdressers, massage and skin care professionals to resume contingent on compliance with the standards that are to be prepared

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support to the oil, gas and the supply industry
Comment: Package of measures to support the oil and gas industry and the supply industry
The recommended size of groups who can meet is being increased from five to a maximum of 20, provided that people can keep at least a metre apart

This means that training and other sports activities for up to 20 people will be possible, provided that people keep at least one metre apart. The recommendations of the Norwegian Directorate of Health and the relevant sports associations will apply and should be followed.

Measure_L4: Use of locker rooms and sanitary facilities prohibited
Comment: Sports halls may be opened, but use of their changing facilities is prohibited.

Events with up to 50 participants may be held in public places provided that the participants can keep a social distance of at least one metre and there is an event organiser responsible for ensuring that the rules are respected. This applies to all types of events, including sports events such as cups and matches.

Measure_L3: Warning against travel to and return from high risk areas
Measure_L4: Warning against travel to and return from abroad
Comment: "The precise role of the organiser should be clarified in standards for the different sector: The prohibition against foreign travel for health personnel is repealed. However, the Government still advises against foreign travel. Anyone who has travelled outside Norway must go into quarantine when they return."

"The precise role of the organiser should be clarified in standards for the different sector: The prohibition against foreign travel for health personnel is repealed. However, the Government still advises against foreign travel. Anyone who has travelled outside Norway must go into quarantine when they return."

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: Quarantine rules after travel abroad may well apply until after the summer, and people should be prepared for this.

Measure_L3: For people who can prove they had covid-19
Comment: The quarantine period is being reduced from 14 to 10 days. Anyone who has been in close contact with a person who is confirmed to have contracted the virus up to 48 hours before they showed the first symptoms must go into quarantine. The quarantine rules still apply if you have been closer than two metres from a person who has confirmed COVID-19 for more than 15 minutes. People who are confirmed to have had COVID-19 are exempt from the duty of quarantine for six months.

Employers should ensure that their employees can remain at least one metre apart throughout working hours. In parts of the country where employees need to use public transport, employers are urged to facilitate working from home and virtual meetings as far as possible, and to require people to be physically present only when necessary. This applies particularly in the Oslo region and other towns where public transport can become congested.

Measure_L3: Promote social distancing measures at workplace
Comment: Employers should ensure that their employees can remain at least one metre apart throughout working hours. In parts of the country where employees need to use public transport, employers are urged to facilitate working from home and virtual meetings as far as possible, and to require people to be physically present only when necessary. This applies particularly in the Oslo region and other towns where public transport can become congested.

Measure_L3: Resumption of educational programmes for adults and immigrants
Comment: Educational programmes for adults and immigrants may restart. This applies to educational programmes for newly arrived immigrants under the Introduction Act, programmes under Chapter 4 of the Adult Education Act, and short courses offered by the folk high schools. These programmes can be restarted provided that they can comply with infection control guidelines.
Driving schools may reopen. They must follow the same infection control rules as other services where there is one-to-one contact.

Measure_L3: Resume indoor hobbies and leisure activities
Comment: The aim is to allow bingo halls and similar facilities to reopen

Universities, university colleges and vocational technical colleges are to continue remote teaching. Students who need to be at their institution to maintain progression in their study programmes may be granted access. They must comply with infection control guidelines

Universities, university colleges and vocational technical colleges are to continue remote teaching. Students who need to be at their institution to maintain progression in their study programmes may be granted access. They must comply with infection control guidelines

Courses run by adult education associations and Skills Norway are to continue remote teaching. Students who need to be at their institution to maintain progression in their study programmes may be granted access. They must comply with infection control guidelines.

Measure_L4: Focusing on children and youth contact sports
Comment: Guidelines for sports activities will be published, focusing on activities for children and young people that involve physical contact, such as football. The aim is to allow them to engage in these activities rather more normally than at present, for example to play matches against others in their team. This must be organised in compliance with infection control standards

All schools are to open for all years by the end of next week (15 May). They must follow the infection control rules, and this may mean that it is not possible for all pupils to be at school at the same time
On 1 June, bars and other establishments that do not serve food and amusement parks can reopen.
And from 15 June, it will be possible to hold events with up to 200 people present.

Measure_L3: Guidelines for re-opening of retail shops and liberal profession
Comment: If you are an employee of a furniture, home-improvement or construction store or a manager of such facility, check the ways to assure the safety of employees and clients. According to the guidelines, which we developed in association with the Main Sanitary Inspectorate, you should, among others: assure increased distance between employees to at least 1,5 metres, and between clients to at least 2 metres prepare a temporary isolation room for people exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms reduce the number of employees using common spaces at the same time display in a visible place information regarding the maximum number of people allowed in the facility at a time – one person per 15 square metres respect the rules of airing, cleaning and disinfecting spaces. Remember that both employees and clients are required to wear face masks and gloves. Below you can find detailed instructions for your facility.

Measure_L4: Guidelines for resuming short-term accommodation services
Comment: If you manage a hotel or other accommodation facility, check how to assure the safety of employees and clients. According to the guidelines, which we developed in association with the Main Sanitary Inspectorate, you should, among others: assure increased distance between employees to at least 1,5 metres reduce the number of employees using common spaces at the same time supply employees with personal protection equipment (if necessary) display in a visible place information regarding the maximum number of people allowed at a time in a given part of the facility prepare a temporary isolation room for people exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms respect the rules of airing, cleaning and disinfecting spaces Below you can find detailed instructions for your facility.

Measure_L3: Guidelines for re-opening of medical and paramedical centers
Comment: If you manage a physiotherapy clinic, check how to assure the safety of employees and patients. According to the guidelines, which we developed in association with the Main Sanitary Inspectorate, you should, among others: assure increased distance between employees to at least 1,5 metres supply employees with personal protection equipment (if necessary) respect the rules of airing, cleaning and disinfecting spaces reduce the possibility of patients moving around the facility prepare the timetable of treatments in such a way that the patients will not gather in the waiting room Below you can find detailed instructions for your clinic.

Measure_L3: Guidelines for re-opening of cultural institutions
Comment: If you manage a library, check how to assure the safety of employees and patients. According to the guidelines, which we developed in association with the Main Sanitary Inspectorate, you should, among others: assure increased distance between employees to at least 1,5 metres reduce the number of employees using common spaces at the same time supply employees with personal protection equipment (if necessary) display in a visible place information regarding the maximum number of people allowed at a time in the library prepare a temporary isolation room for people exhibiting COVID-19 symptoms respect the rules of airing, cleaning and disinfecting spaces restrict access to appliances operated by touch, open access book collections and card catalogues.

All seats can be occupied with respect to hygiene measures
Comment: From July 1, airline passengers can take all seats. Both on international and domestic flights it is obligatory to: 1.to provide hand disinfectants on board the aircraft, 2.aircraft disinfection: a) once a day in the case of air operations with passengers, b) after each flight operation with a sick person or suspected of being infected with an infectious disease, (c) before and after any flight operation with passengers of 6 hours or more. 3. handing over to passengers, via the cabin crew, to fill in the forms of traveler's location cards for health purposes and to collect completed cards - if the passenger crosses the state border to go to his place of residence or stay in Poland.

From Monday, 4 May 2020 we rescind significant commerce restrictions. Shopping centers and large-area stores will open, with limited capacity and no food consumption on site.

Measure_L4: Furniture, home-improvement and construction stores (on week-ends)
Comment: From Monday, 4 May 2020 we rescind significant commerce restrictions. Furniture, home-improvement and construction stores will open on weekends. We rescind the previous ban on these stores’ operation on weekends.

Measure_L3: Re-opening of short-term accommodations and hotels
Measure_L4: For all guests with adaptive measures
Comment: Hotels and accommodation facilities will operate without swimming pools and gyms. Until now, hotels did not accommodate guests except people on business trips or those quarantined. We lift this ban. Accommodation services can be provided with particular safety rules applied. The functioning of restaurants and recreation areas in the accommodation facilities is restricted. Gyms, practice rooms and pools will remain closed. Restaurants are allowed to serve meals delivered to guests’ rooms. They cannot serve meals on site.

Comment: Patients with illnesses and pain will be able to participate in therapeutic rehabilitation starting May 4. Massage parlors remain closed.

We lift the ban on functioning of libraries, archives, museums and other cultural institutions. Cultural institutions will be reopening gradually, at different times. The exact date will be decided by the management of a given institution, after consultation with regional sanitary-epidemiological station.

Starting May 4 selected outdoor sports facilities will reopen. The following safety regulations will be in force while using outdoor sports facilities: social distancing obligatory face protection (when entering the sports facility. while using the facility, e.g. playing fields, face masks are not obligatory) limited number of people allowed in the facility user verification (people entering the facility should be reported to the administrator) using locker rooms and sanitary facilities is prohibited (apart from restrooms) obligatory disinfection of sports equipment after each use and each group of people obligatory hand disinfection for those entering and leaving the facility using only personal training equipment of disinfection after each use

Measure_L3: Guidelines for re-opening of educational institutions and leisure facilities
Measure_L4: Guidelines for re-opening of schools and daycare
Comment: The Main Sanitary Inspectorate has issued detailed anti-outbreak recommendations for preschools, preschool units in primary schools and other forms of pre-primary education facilities, along with daycare facilities for children under the age of 3. The guidelines concern, among others: organization of care, hygiene, cleaning and disinfection of spaces and surfaces and gastronomy. The materials contain rules of conduct in case of suspected infection of personnel. Attached are detailed instructions for hand washing and disinfection and appropriate removal of face masks and gloves.
Starting from May 4 students of technical secondary schools will be able to participate in additional forms of professional practice.

Children of working parents will be able to return to nurseries and preschools. Starting from Wednesday, May 6 management bodies can reopen the facilities, in accordance with the guidelines issued by the Main Sanitary Inspectorate, Ministry of National Education and Ministry of Family, Labour and Social Policy. Due to epidemiological situation the management body can limit the number of children in a preschool class or the number of children provided with care in nursery. If the principal of the facility does not meet the OSH and Main Sanitary Inspectorate regulations (and, as a consequence, is not able to reopen the facility on May 6) they are allowed to, with the agreement of management body, suspend the operation until the guidelines are followed. They are obliged to inform the appropriate School Superintendent about this fact.
