Return operation of nationals in different countries (pupils on exchange)
Comment: return operations for pupils on exchange programs in different countries

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Measure_L3: Increase delivery capacity for food products
Comment: Post service is delegated to deliver 7 day a week  food and products for daily needs ordered online

A month ago the FDFA launched an unprecedented repatriation operation in cooperation with Swiss, Edelweiss und Helvetic. The first flight departed Zurich on March 22 for San José (Costa Rica).  Since then, the FDFA's Crisis Management Centre (KMZ) has organised 35 flights from all parts of the world. Thirty-three flights to Switzerland have been completed successfully, allowing 6950 persons stranded abroad, including 3974 Swiss citizens, to return home.

Measure_L3: Return operation of nationals in Costa Rica
Return operation of nationals in Peru, Colombia

Measure_L4: Restrict entry by land and by air from Italy, France, Germany, Austria and Spain, and non-Schengen States
Comment: Switzerland extends border controls to all Schengen States. At its meeting on 25 March, the Federal Council was informed by the FDJP that entry restrictions have been extended to all Schengen States. This measure will increase the protection given to the population against the coronavirus. Last week, the Federal Council took the decision to impose restrictions on entry by land and by air from Italy, France, Germany, Austria and Spain, and from all non-Schengen States. Since midnight, these stricter entry requirements have also applied to flights from all remaining Schengen States with the exception of the Principality of Liechtenstein. The relevant authorities in the EU have been notified of the changes.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Facilitate loans for entrepreneurs and businesses
Comment: During its extraordinary meeting on 25 March 2020, the Federal Council addressed the issue of liquidity assistance for SMEs, which should have rapid access to credit facilities to bridge liquidity shortfalls caused by the new coronavirus pandemic. Companies are advised to apply for the credit facilities at their main bank. Facilities will be secured by the Confederation. The corresponding ordinance enters into force on 26 March 2020, from which date credit applications can be submitted.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Gives banks more flexibility in granting credits
Comment: During its meeting on 27 March 2020, the Federal Council approved the proposal of the Swiss National Bank (SNB) to deactivate the countercyclical capital buffer with immediate effect. This measure gives banks more flexibility in granting credits designed to cushion the economic impact of the coronavirus pandemic. The countercyclical capital buffer strengthens banking sector resilience in the event of corrections resulting from imbalances on the mortgage and real estate markets. At the same time, it helps to prevent these markets from overheating. It requires banks to hold additional capital for residential mortgage loans. In view of the exceptional situation caused by the coronavirus pandemic, the SNB submitted a proposal to the Federal Council requesting the immediate deactivation of the countercyclical capital buffer. The Federal Council approved this proposal at its meeting on 27 March 2020.

In the current crisis, the federal government wants to exploit the potential available in the Swiss scientific community to an even greater extent by working with scientists to find the best approach to overcoming the pandemic. To this end, it has set up a science task force of researchers from higher education institutions throughout the country. The Swiss National COVID-19 Science Task Force has therefore been set up by the Federal Council Coronavirus Crisis Unit, the State Secretariat for Education, Research and Innovation SERI and the Federal Office of Public Health FOPH. Headed by Matthias Egger, president of the National Research Council at the Swiss National Science Foundation SNSF, the Science Task Force will act as an advisory body to the Federal Council, the head of the Federal Department of Home Affairs FDHA, and to the federal and cantonal offices concerned. Its members do not represent the higher education institutions to which they are affiliated but are instead selected on the basis of their specialist expertise.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: At its meeting on 8 April 2020, the Federal Council instructed the Federal Department of Finance (FDF) together with the Federal Department of the Environment, Transport, Energy and Communications (DETEC) and the Federal Department of Economic Affairs, Education and Research (EAER) to draft a proposal on providing temporary liquidity support to the Swiss aviation industry, which has been particularly affected by the coronavirus pandemic. The focus is on federal guarantees for airlines: they are subject to strict conditions and are only to be granted if the companies are unable to meet their liquidity needs by any other means.

In order to better harness the efforts being made in civil society to combat the corona crisis, the federal government is working with an organisation called staatslabor to set up a ‘COVID-19 Civil Society Point of Contact’. In addition to the efforts already being made to work more closely with the scientific community, the Federal Council Coronavirus Crisis Unit (KSBC) is now also setting up a liaison unit to better tap the potential of civil society initiatives. The liaison unit will field enquiries and concerns addressed to the KSBC and offer a platform for exchanges between the KSBC and civil society initiatives. This will make it possible to evaluate potential opportunities for cooperation between individual initiatives and the relevant federal offices.

The Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) is contributing financially and with relief supplies to help overcome the global COVID-19 pandemic. To this end, it is adapting existing programmes by redirecting CHF 56 million of funding. The SDC has also transferred CHF 18 million to international organisations. It continues to deliver relief supplies to affected countries, including protective suits which were dispatched to Italy on 8 April 2020.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Economic support to small and medium enterprises
Comment: Innovative start-ups are an important factor in the success of the Swiss economy. To date, however, start-ups have had little or even no access to the Confederation's existing emergency aid. Therefore, as a supplement to the federal COVID-19 credits and cantonal support measures, the Confederation is planning to use the system of guarantees to shield start-ups from coronavirus-related insolvency. Given the urgency, the Federal Council decided on 22 April 2020 to use the existing system of guarantees for SMEs to provide support for start-ups. This approach can be implemented without the need for a time-consuming legislative amendment. It is planned to create a new procedure for start-ups under the existing system of guarantees by 30 April 2020. The Confederation will guarantee 65% of a credit, and the cantons the remaining 35%. It is for individual cantons to decide whether they wish to offer this guarantee facility, originally intended for SMEs, to their start-ups. Some cantons have already committed considerable resources to other kinds of support for start-ups.

A flight from India scheduled for tomorrow and one from Africa next week will conclude the largest repatriation operation ever mounted by the Federal Department of Foreign Affairs (FDFA). The main focus is now on providing support for Swiss citizens who, for a variety of reasons, have been unable or unwilling to return to Switzerland.

The measures introduced to combat the coronavirus epidemic are being followed well and are having the desired effect. They will be extended by a week until Sunday, 26 April, but should then gradually begin to be eased before the end of the month. That is the decision taken by the Federal Council at its meeting on 8 April. The Federal Council will decide on steps to ease the measures at its next meeting on 16 April.

Measure_L3: Re-opening of medical and paramedical centers
Measure_L4: Re-opening of hospitals for non urgent cares
Comment: On 27 April, hospitals will be able to resume all medical procedures, including non-urgent procedures, and outpatient medical practices

Measure_L4: Hairdressing salons, massage practices and cosmetic studios
Comment: hairdressing salons, massage practices and cosmetic studios will be allowed to reopen. DIY stores, garden centres and florists will also be allowed to reopen. The protection of the public and of staff must be assured. These are the steps decided by the Federal Council at its meeting on 16 April. If the situation allows, schools for children of compulsory school age and shops will be able to reopen on 11 May. On 8 June, upper-secondary schools, vocational schools and higher education institutions, as well as museums, zoos and libraries may reopen. The Federal Council also issued further details with regard to protecting workers at especially high risk.

Measure_L4: International Committee of the Red Cross
Comment: Switzerland to provide CHF 400 million in support of international action to combat the coronavirus. Developing countries are particularly vulnerable to Covid-19. The pandemic is compounding an already precarious situation in countries beset by poverty, armed conflict or natural disasters. To mitigate the consequences of the pandemic, the Federal Council has decided to provide the International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) with a CHF 200 million interest-free loan and to contribute CHF 25 million to an IMF rapid credit facility to help countries address the pandemic. A further CHF 175 million is to be allocated to help strengthen internationally active organisations and international cooperation to tackle the Covid-19 pandemic. With these funds, Switzerland is showing solidarity during the global crisis.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: The federal government is founding the Task Force Perspective Apprenticeship 2020 to ensure that as many young people as possible find an apprenticeship position by the beginning of August 2020 despite the coronavirus

Measure_L4: Extend period of validity of all safety certificates
Comment: Federal Council decides to amend the Ordinance on the Travel Industry (RGV) with the aim of mitigating the effects of epidemic measures on the exhibitor trade. On the one hand, the safety certificates are extended by six months, on the other hand, foreign inspection bodies are automatically recognized.
15 border crossings will be opened to traffic again in order to ensure the smoothest possible flow of traffic in the cantons of Graubünden, Ticino and Solothurn as well as in western Switzerland

Bern, 05/01/2020 - On April 29, 2020, the Federal Council decided that training, further education and examinations in road traffic are permitted again from May 11, 2020, provided that the organizer has developed and implemented a protection concept and ensures that the recommendations of the BAG regarding hygiene and social distance are observed.

Measure_L4: Limit up to 4 persons per table and social distancing
Comment: The Federal Council passed the changes in the Covid-19 regulation for the opening of gastronomic establishments on May 11th. A maximum of four people or parents with children are allowed at one table. All guests have to be seated and with a two-meter gap or separating elements between the tables. In order to enable contact tracing in restaurants as well, the contact details of a person should be recorded for each guest group. This information is voluntary.

The Federal Council passed the changes in the Covid-19 regulation for the opening of gastronomic establishments on May 11th. A maximum of four people or parents with children are allowed at one table. All guests have to be seated and with a two-meter gap or separating elements between the tables. In order to enable contact tracing in restaurants as well, the contact details of a person should be recorded for each guest group. This information is voluntary.

The Federal Council passed the changes in the Covid-19 regulation for the opening of gastronomic establishments on May 11th. A maximum of four people or parents with children are allowed at one table. All guests have to be seated and with a two-meter gap or separating elements between the tables. In order to enable contact tracing in restaurants as well, the contact details of a person should be recorded for each guest group. This information is voluntary.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: With CHF 65 million, the federal government supports institutions providing additional childcare who have lost earnings due to the corona crisis

The Federal Council passed an ordinance on the implementation of the central Swiss qualification for university entrance examination 2020. In subjects in which a written examination has already taken place, an additional oral examination is waived in order to protect those concerned. The chosen procedure ensures that the examination candidates receive recognized qualification certificates in time so that they can start studying at the tertiary level in autumn 2020.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support tourism, sport and culture sectors
Comment: A stabilization package of CHF 350 million for the operation of the football and ice hockey leagues and CHF 150 million to support popular and competitive sports. The consequences of the corona crisis (collapse of ticket and season ticket sales, the cancellation of small and large sporting events, the withdrawal of sponsors) threaten the pillars of the Swiss sports system, from local clubs to professional clubs and associations.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The "Ordinance on the pilot test with the 'Swiss Proximity Tracing System' to notify people who were potentially exposed to the coronavirus (Covid-19)" is limited to June 30, 2020. It is based on the data protection act and regulates the organization, operation, the processed data and the use of the proximity tracing app for the duration of the pilot phase. The app is expected to be tested from next week by employees of the Swiss Federal Institutes of Technology in Lausanne and Zurich, by members of the armed forces and employees of hospitals as well as the federal and cantonal administrations. The app is also made available to other people and organizations so that they can uncover any technical defects or problems with usability. The Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner considers the upcoming trial operation of the app to be permissible under data protection law.

Measure_L3: Fight fraud to Covid-19 support scheme
Comment: The State Secretariat for Economic Affairs SECO has decreed a concept to combat abuse based on the interim aid for COVID-19

Bilateral entry is again permitted between Switzerland, Germany and Austria for people who want to visit their life partners or relatives or take part in important family events. The same applies to owners of self-used properties and allotments, as well as agricultural, hunting or forest areas. People who have to look after animals are also allowed to enter.

Measure_L4: Only owners of properties in the country
Comment: Bilateral entry is again permitted between Switzerland, Germany and Austria for people who want to visit their life partners or relatives or take part in important family events. The same applies to owners of self-used properties and allotments, as well as agricultural, hunting or forest areas. People who have to look after animals are also allowed to enter.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: Extraordinary financial support of 10 million francs to support the Swiss wine industry

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Government supports the obtention of unemployment benefits
Comment: The federal government makes an exceptional contribution of CHF 14.2 billion to the unemployment insurance (ALV)

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Economic support to the media sector
Comment: Immediate state aid for the media, which was hard hit by the coronavirus pandemic, in the amount of CHF 57.5 million

Measure_L4: To keep remittances running during the crisis
Comment: Switzerland calls on the international community to keep remittance channels open as they are vital to the most deprived communities, such as as for families living abroad for migrants

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The pilot phase for the SwissCovid App with proximity tracing has started
Recruiting is being carried out again. Around 12,000 recruits and cadres will start their summer recruit schools.

Measure_L4: International Development Organization (IDA / World Bank) and the African Development Fund (AfDF)
Comment: Switzerland is contributing a total of CHF 879 million to the International Development Organization (IDA / World Bank) and the African Development Fund (AfDF). The money will be used to fight poverty, promote sustainable development and tackle the health, social and economic impact of the COVID-19 crisis in the world's poorest countries. In addition, Switzerland is contributing CHF 115 million to the Multilateral Debt Relief Initiative (MDRI).

Switzerland is contributing a total of CHF 879 million to the International Development Organization (IDA / World Bank) and the African Development Fund (AfDF). The money will be used to fight poverty, promote sustainable development and tackle the health, social and economic impact of the COVID-19 crisis in the world's poorest countries. In addition, Switzerland is contributing CHF 115 million to the Multilateral Debt Relief Initiative (MDRI).
All services and celebrations of all religions are allowed again. The religious communities must develop protection concepts and ensure that chains of infection are tracked

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The Federal Council has approved the legal basis for the new SwissCovid App. With the adapted Epidemics Act, a proximity tracing system can now be operated. The data processed in the SwissCovid App serve the purpose of notifying the participating people if they may have been exposed to the coronavirus. The app supplements conventional contact tracing and the participation is voluntary

Measure_L4: Resume statutory working and rest times for hospital staff
Comment: The usual working and rest times will apply again to hospital staff. From the beginning of June, the statutory working and rest times will again apply to hospital staff, as the situation in most hospital departments has meanwhile normalized.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The Swiss population should be guaranteed maximum privacy protection when using the SwissCovid app. To do this, the app must have a correspondingly high level of security. In order to achieve this requirement, the first version of the Swiss Proximity Tracing System is now available for a broad security test by the public, the Public Security Test.
The ban on gathering in public spaces, specifically in public places, on walking paths and in parks, will be relaxed. The upper limit will be increased up to 30 people.

Switzerland will support the vaccination alliance GAVI with a contribution of CHF 30 million. Based on her mandate and her experience, GAVI could make a significant contribution to ensuring that a future vaccination against COVID-19 also reaches people in the poorest countries.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The Swiss population should adhere to three rules during the relaxation phase. 1) If you have coronavirus symptoms, have it tested immediately and stay at home 2) Provide contact details whenever possible for tracking purposes 3) Isolation in the event of a positive test and quarantine in the event of contact with a person who tested positive

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The Swiss population should adhere to three rules during the relaxation phase. 1) If you have coronavirus symptoms, have it tested immediately and stay at home 2) Provide contact details whenever possible for tracking purposes 3) Isolation in the event of a positive test and quarantine in the event of contact with a person who tested positive

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The Swiss population should adhere to three rules during the relaxation phase. 1) If you have coronavirus symptoms, have it tested immediately and stay at home 2) Provide contact details whenever possible for tracking purposes 3) Isolation in the event of a positive test and quarantine in the event of contact with a person who tested positive

Measure_L3: Abolish regulatory fines for non-compliance with Covid-19 measures
Measure_L4: Abolished the regulatory fines for non-compliance with the distance.
Comment: Fines abolished: With the current easing measures, the personal responsibility of each individual is coming more and more to the fore. A lot is possible again, including gatherings of up to 30 people in public spaces and events of up to 300 people. The BAG continues to appeal to the population to keep the distance. The Federal Council has abolished the regulatory fines for non-compliance with the distance.
Private and public events with up to 300 people are allowed. This includes family events, trade fairs, concerts, theater performances or film screenings, but also political and civil society rallies.

Measure_L4: Training for all sports without restrictions
Comment: The same rules as to all other events apply to sporting events. Training is again permitted for all types of sport without restriction of group size. This also applies to sports activities in which there is close physical contact. In these sports, however, training must take place in constant teams and attendance lists must be kept. Competitions in sports with constant, close physical contact, such as swinging, judo, boxing or couple dancing are probably prohibited.

Measure_L4: Adaptive measure for sports with close physical contact: attendance lists
Comment: The same rules as to all other events apply to sporting events. Training is again permitted for all types of sport without restriction of group size. This also applies to sports activities in which there is close physical contact. In these sports, however, training must take place in constant teams and attendance lists must be kept. Competitions in sports with constant, close physical contact, such as swinging, judo, boxing or couple dancing are probably prohibited.

Measure_L4: Ban on competitions of sports with close physical contact
Comment: The same rules as to all other events apply to sporting events. Training is again permitted for all types of sport without restriction of group size. This also applies to sports activities in which there is close physical contact. In these sports, however, training must take place in constant teams and attendance lists must be kept. Competitions in sports with constant, close physical contact, such as swinging, judo, boxing or couple dancing are probably prohibited.

The same rules as to all other events apply to sporting events. Training is again permitted for all types of sport without restriction of group size. This also applies to sports activities in which there is close physical contact. In these sports, however, training must take place in constant teams and attendance lists must be kept. Competitions in sports with constant, close physical contact, such as swinging, judo, boxing or couple dancing are probably prohibited.

Holiday camps for children and young people with appropriate protection concepts are possible. Children and young people should spend the days in constant groups if possible. There is an upper limit of 300 participants for camps, and attendance lists must also be kept.

Measure_L3: Re-opening of outdoor attractions and touristic sites
Comment: Tourist facilities such as campsites, toboggan runs, rope parks  and mountain railways are reopened

Measure_L3: Re-opening of public outdoor leisure facilities
Comment: All entertainment and leisure facilities such as amusement parks, zoos and botanical gardens can reopen, as can swimming pools and wellness facilities.

Measure_L3: Resume activity in gastronomy and trade facilities
Measure_L4: No limit on the number of persons per table
Comment: In restaurants, groups of more than 4 people are now allowed at the table. The establishments should ensure the follow-up of contacts. for groups of more than four people, they are obliged to record the contact details of one guest per table. Consumption continues to be exclusively seated. All restaurants have to close at midnight. Discos and night clubs have to close at midnight too. They must also keep attendance lists and no more than 300 admissions are possible per evening.

Measure_L3: Resume activity in gastronomy and trade facilities
Comment: In restaurants, groups of more than 4 people are now allowed at the table. The establishments should ensure the follow-up of contacts. for groups of more than four people, they are obliged to record the contact details of one guest per table. Consumption continues to be exclusively seated. All restaurants have to close at midnight. Discos and night clubs have to close at midnight too. They must also keep attendance lists and no more than 300 admissions are possible per evening.

They must also keep attendance lists and no more than 300 admissions are possible per evening.

Attendance learning in secondary schools, vocational schools and universities  is again permitted. The cantons or the educational institutions decide how lessons are resumed on site. They can organize the lessons flexibly and continue to use the possibilities of distance learning.

Attendance learning in secondary schools, vocational schools and universities  is again permitted. The cantons or the educational institutions decide how lessons are resumed on site. They can organize the lessons flexibly and continue to use the possibilities of distance learning.

Attendance learning in secondary schools, vocational schools and universities  is again permitted. The cantons or the educational institutions decide how lessons are resumed on site. They can organize the lessons flexibly and continue to use the possibilities of distance learning.

Measure_L4: Federal Council decides to introduce rapid tests In order to determine a Covid-19 infection, antigen rapid tests can also be used from November 2, 2020 in addition to the tests already used (PCR tests). This enables broader and faster testing of the population. More positive cases in the population can be quickly detected and isolated. The rapid tests are paid for by the federal government - but only for those people to whom the recommendations of the BAG apply.
Comment: The Federal Council also recommends working from home where possible, also to avoid peak loads in public transport. However, it is up to the company to decide whether to return to work. Employees who are particularly at risk remain protected. The employer remains obliged to let particularly vulnerable people work from home. If an on-site presence is essential, he must protect the person concerned by adapting the processes or the workplace accordingly.
In view of the epidemiological development, the Federal Council has decided to end the extraordinary situation under the Epidemics Act on June 19, 2020.

Measure_L4: Highly qualified workers from third countries
Comment: Swiss companies can again employ highly qualified workers from third countries if this is in the public interest or if they urgently need them.

Measure_L4: Partial end of mobilization of the army to support frontline workers
Comment: The members of the army (AdA) who were mobilized to support the civilian health system in the context of COVID-19 will be released from the medical area. There are still around 1000 AdA in the assistance service.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Monetary bonus to members of the civil defense
Comment: For part of their service in the corona pandemic, members of the civil defense receive the difference between their earned income and the compensation for income compensation.

Measure_L2: The government provide assistance to vulnerable populations
Measure_L3: Measures to protect the health and rights of vulnerable population
Comment: The Federal Council extended the measures taken at the beginning of April to protect the health of all those involved in the asylum procedure by 3 months. He has thus ensured that, on the one hand, protection against infection with the coronavirus is guaranteed and, on the other hand, the core functions of the asylum system are maintained and the asylum and removal procedures can continue to be carried out.
Border controls will be fully lifted with Germany, Austria and France.

An aid transport organized by Switzerland has reached Venezuela's capital Caracas. The material, especially medical goods, had previously been brought to Switzerland by nine different partner organizations, where it was reloaded and transported on to Venezuela by SDC Humanitarian Aid. The aid supplies are intended to support the population of the South American country in dealing with the humanitarian crisis and fighting the COVID19 pandemic.

The Federal Council has decided on three financial contributions to the International Monetary Fund (IMF). The contributions serve to secure the regular funds of the IMF, the special support of the poorer countries in dealing with the Covid-19 pandemic, as well as the debt relief of Somalia

Events and gatherings with up to 1000 people are again allowed. However, it must always be possible to track contacts. The organizer must ensure that the maximum number of people to be contacted is not greater than 300, for example by subdividing into sectors.

Communication of simplified distancing rules. The minimum distance between two people is reduced from 2 meters to 1.5 meters in view of the low number of cases. If the distance of 1.5 meters cannot be kept for more than 15 minutes, there is a considerable risk of infection. The distance can still be exceeded if a mask is worn or partitions are present. For events with fixed seats, for example at a concert or in the cinema, it is sufficient to leave one seat empty. If the distance measures are not possible at events, occasions or in schools, contact lists must be kept. In the event of a positive case, this ensures that the contacts can be tracked (contact tracing). Face masks are mandatory in public transports

The home office recommendations are repealed, as are the requirements for the protection of the group of particularly vulnerable people. They can also return to their workplace. However, the employer is obliged to take appropriate measures to protect the health of the employees

The situation in the Middle East has worsened as a result of the corona crisis. The pandemic is having a serious impact on the region's population. Due to the growing needs, Switzerland is transferring an additional CHF 2 million to the United Nations Aid Organization for Palestine Refugees in the Middle East

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The Federal Council also passed the ordinance on the proximity tracing system, which enables the SwissCovid app to be launched. The Federal Council recommends using the app. This complements classic contact tracing.

The federal government accounts for all costs for corona tests. So far, the costs for the virus tests have been partly covered by health insurers and partly by the cantons. This regulation meant that not all patients were treated equally

Measure_L3: Support production of medical equipment for developing countries
Measure_L4: Production of simple and inexpensive respirators
Comment: The Federal Department of Foreign Affairs is supporting the production of simple and inexpensive respirators that are affordable for emerging and developing countries with start-up funding of CHF 1.5 million. There is a serious shortage of ventilators in many countries. For people who have breathing difficulties - for example because of the coronavirus - access to these vital machines is a major problem. The FDFA is therefore committed to the production of simple and inexpensive ventilators with humanitarian intent: With start-up funding, it supports an ETH project to manufacture such devices in Ukraine, which are also affordable for emerging and developing countries.

Measure_L4: End of mobilization of the army
Comment: The last remaining members of the army (AdA) will be released from their duties today and dismissed

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Economic support to self-employees and free-lancers
Comment: The entitlement of self-employed persons directly or indirectly affected by measures against the Corona virus to Corona income compensation will be extended until September 16. The people employed in their own company in the event area who are in a hardship situation can now also claim Corona income compensation

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: The Federal Council has extended the maximum duration of short-time work compensation from twelve to eighteen months.

Measure_L2: Secure future access to anti-Covid19 medication and vaccine
Comment: Remdesivir can now also be used more widely in Switzerland outside of clinical studies for the treatment of COVID-19 patients. After a careful examination, the Swiss Agency for Therapeutic Products, Swissmedic, decided in record time that Remdesivir may be temporarily placed on the market. This means that more COVID-19 patients can now be treated while the approval documents are being examined.
The Federal Council has to introduce a mask mandatory for public transport throughout Switzerland.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: The new coronavirus has been spreading repeatedly in Switzerland since mid-June after infected people entered the country from countries in the Schengen area and from non-Schengen states. That is why anyone entering Switzerland from certain areas must go into quarantine for ten days from Monday, July 6th. The BAG maintains a corresponding list that is updated regularly.

The Federal Council is completely lifting the corona-related restrictions on the admission of workers from third countries - i.e. countries outside the EU and EFTA. Applications from third-country nationals who are not gainfully employed - for example pensioners - should also be processed by the cantons again from this date in accordance with the usual criteria. However, third-country nationals will not yet be able to travel to Switzerland for vacation:

Measure_L3: all EU / EFTA states and the United Kingdom
Comment: Full free movement of persons with all EU / EFTA states and the United Kingdom with the exception of Bulgaria, Ireland, Croatia, Romania and Cyprus.

Measure_L4: Bulgaria, Ireland, Croatia, Romania and Cyprus
Comment: Full free movement of persons with all EU / EFTA states and the United Kingdom with the exception of Bulgaria, Ireland, Croatia, Romania and Cyprus.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Measure_L4: Test recruited persons in the army
Comment: In order to protect members of the army and to be able to prevent any infection or spread, all recruits and cadres were tested for SARS-CoV-2 (coronavirus) at the start of the recruit school. The test results produced 0.3% positive results.

As an immediate measure at the beginning of the corona crisis, the federal government provided various large consumers and cantons with masks that came from the pandemic preparedness in 2007. These masks are now being recalled by the federal government as a precautionary measure, since traces of fungal attack were found during an investigation. All of these masks are replaced free of charge.

Measure_L3: Algeria, Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, Morocco, Montenegro, New Zealand, Rwanda, South Korea, Thailand, Tunisia and Uruguay as well as the EU states outside the Schengen area (Bulgaria, Ireland, Croatia, Romania and Cyprus), China
Comment: In its meeting on July 1, 2020, the Federal Council also took note of the recommendations of the EU Council to lift the corona-related entry restrictions for 15 countries from July 1, 2020. Switzerland is expected to follow these recommendations, but not until July 20, 2020 and with the exception of Serbia. The FDJP intends to go to Algeria, Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, Morocco, Montenegro, New Zealand, Rwanda, South Korea, Thailand, Tunisia and Uruguay as well as the EU states outside the Schengen area (Bulgaria, Ireland, Croatia, Romania and Cyprus) from the list of risk countries. In implementing the EU recommendation, China is also to be removed from the list, provided that reciprocity is guaranteed for people entering from Switzerland.

In its meeting on July 1, 2020, the Federal Council also took note of the recommendations of the EU Council to lift the corona-related entry restrictions for 15 countries from July 1, 2020. Switzerland is expected to follow these recommendations, but not until July 20, 2020 and with the exception of Serbia. The FDJP intends to go to Algeria, Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, Morocco, Montenegro, New Zealand, Rwanda, South Korea, Thailand, Tunisia and Uruguay as well as the EU states outside the Schengen area (Bulgaria, Ireland, Croatia, Romania and Cyprus) from the list of risk countries. In implementing the EU recommendation, China is also to be removed from the list, provided that reciprocity is guaranteed for people entering from Switzerland.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: With new posters, the Federal Office of Public Health is reminding the population that the rules continue to apply and are important, also and especially during the holiday season, because "the coronavirus is still there". Washing hands and keeping your distance remain the most important rules that everyone can use to protect themselves and others from infection

Measure_L4: End of mobilization of community service workers
Comment: Most of the emergency missions by community service workers ends on July 31, 2020. Between March 16, 2020 and July 31, 2020 community service providers were involved in 565 emergency missions across Switzerland to deal with the COVID-19 pandemic. Emergency operations have shortened notification periods under civil service law and are tax-exempt for the emergency operations

Persons from third countries who have a life partner in Switzerland are now allowed to enter Switzerland if they can prove this relationship. People from states and areas with an increased risk of infection are subject to the quarantine obligation regardless of this.

Measure_L2: Secure future access to anti-Covid19 medication and vaccine
Comment: In order to guarantee Switzerland early access to the vaccine from Moderna, the federal government has signed a contract for the purchase of 4.5 million vaccine doses.

Measure_L2: Secure future access to anti-Covid19 medication and vaccine
Measure_L4: Reservation contract for a therapeutic agents
Comment: The federal government has signed a reservation contract for a therapeutic agent against the new coronavirus (SARS-CoV-2) with the Swiss company Molecular Partners. If the drug successfully passes clinical tests and is approved for the market, Switzerland receives priority access. The clinical studies are planned for autumn 2020. With the contract, the federal government secures priority access to the first 200,000 doses of the Covid-19 drug and the right to delivery of up to 3 million additional doses.

The loan amount of CHF 288.5 million relates to the costs of corona tests. In order to be able to react quickly to an increase in the number of cases, as much as possible and sensible should be tested. The federal government has therefore been assuming all costs for corona tests since June 25, 2020

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Comment: The Federal Council has decided to apply to Parliament for a commitment loan of CHF 5.82 million for an interim solution to secure ethanol stocks. This is to ensure that in the short and medium term, if demand rises again, enough ethanol will be available to supply the country.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Government supports the obtention of unemployment benefits
Comment: Unemployment insurance (ALV) has been feeling the economic effects of the Covid-19 epidemic strongly since March 2020. The federal government should therefore support them with an additional CHF 14.2 billion. The Covid 19 crisis has led to ALV spending on short-time work compensation to an unprecedented extent. The effects of the Covid 19 crisis on the ALV finances are very negative and will continue to have an effect for some time.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Comment: The Federal Council has decided to support the Skyguide air traffic control system with up to CHF 400 million in 2020 and 2021. Air traffic cannot function without air traffic control. Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, flight movements have collapsed, which is why Skyguide's fee income is falling sharply.

The Federal Council has also decided that a mask must also be worn on airplanes. It has been mandatory to wear a mask in public transport since July 6th. The measure now affects all scheduled and charter flights that take off or land in Switzerland, regardless of the airline.

Measure_L4: Campaign work, hotline and SwissCovid App
Comment: The Federal Council is applying for a supplementary credit for coping with the Covid 19 pandemic of CHF 31.6 million for campaign work, operating the hotlines or developing the Corona app.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support to public transport and freight companies
Comment: The Federal Council wants to finance the loss of income with 700 million francs that public transport and rail freight companies have suffered due to the corona pandemic. Most of his proposals received a positive response during the consultation

Measure_L3: To support law enforcement/sanction in case of no compliance
Comment: The Federal Office of Public Health and the Security Directorate of the Canton of Zurich agree to cooperate to monitor whether return travelers from Covid-19 risk areas comply with the quarantine obligation.

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Measure_L3: Fixing price for specific protective products
Comment: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, the need for disinfectants has risen sharply. In order to be able to expand the offer quickly and at lower costs, the Federal Council extended the exemption of surface disinfectants from the incentive tax until December 31, 2021

Measure_L2: The government provide assistance to vulnerable populations
Measure_L3: Measures to protect the health and rights of vulnerable population
Comment: At the beginning of April, the Federal Council decided on measures to protect the health of all those involved in the asylum procedure. He has thus ensured that, on the one hand, protection against infection with the coronavirus is guaranteed and, on the other hand, the core functions of the asylum system are maintained and the asylum and removal procedures can continue to be carried out. The Federal Council has now extended the relevant ordinance to the end of June 2021.

Measure_L3: Landing bans on aircrafts from high risk areas
Measure_L4: Including transit flights via non-risk countries
Comment: Air travelers from risk countries can no longer enter Switzerland using transit flights via non-risk countries. Conversely, air travelers from non-risk countries can enter Switzerland, even if they have to change trains at airports in a risk country, provided they do not leave the airport's transit zone there. The previous entry restrictions were circumvented by choosing appropriate transit airports.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Economic support to the most affected workers and businesses
Comment: People who are unable to work can continue to receive Corona earnings compensation after September 16, 2020 if one of the following situations applies to them. 1) Parents who have to interrupt their employment because childcare is no longer guaranteed 2) In the case of a quarantine ordered by the canton doctor or another authority 3) Self-employed persons when the company closes. Self-employed people whose activities are discontinued or significantly restricted by order of the authorities. When a company closes, e.g. B. a bar or a club, the entitlement exists for the duration of the closure 4) Ban on events. In the event of a ban on events, self-employed people who would have provided a service for this event are entitled to Corona income compensation. The daily allowances cover the days on which the event should have taken place, including the preparation time.

Measure_L3: State aid, taxation and social security
Measure_L4: Financial compensation for parents who stay home for childcare
Comment: People who are unable to work can continue to receive Corona earnings compensation after September 16, 2020 if one of the following situations applies to them. 1) Parents who have to interrupt their employment because childcare is no longer guaranteed 2) In the case of a quarantine ordered by the canton doctor or another authority 3) Self-employed persons when the company closes. Self-employed people whose activities are discontinued or significantly restricted by order of the authorities. When a company closes, e.g. B. a bar or a club, the entitlement exists for the duration of the closure 4) Ban on events. In the event of a ban on events, self-employed people who would have provided a service for this event are entitled to Corona income compensation. The daily allowances cover the days on which the event should have taken place, including the preparation time.

Measure_L1: Case identification, contact tracing and related measures
Comment: Bern, 09/11/2020 - At its meeting on September 11, 2020, the Federal Council decided on the quarantine rules for travelers from neighboring countries: Only regions that are above the limit value are added to the list of states and areas with an increased risk of infection from neighboring countries set, but not the whole country. Border regions can be excluded from inclusion in the list. In doing so, the Federal Council is taking into account, on the one hand, the steep rise in the number of infections and, on the other hand, the close ties in the border regions. The amended ordinance comes into force on September 14th. At the same time, the list of risk areas is updated.

Measure_L4: Those working in culture after a cultural event, athletes after a competition and participants in specialist congresses
Comment: Exceptions to the quarantine: requirement Now also exempt from the quarantine requirement are those working in culture after a cultural event, athletes after a competition and participants in specialist congresses. The prerequisite for this is that a specific protection concept is drawn up and implemented for the event in question abroad. Also exempt from the quarantine requirement are people who have to travel to a risk area for professional or medical reasons and cannot be postponed. The prerequisite is that the stay abroad does not last more than five days and a protection concept is drawn up and implemented.

Measure_L4: Medical workers returning from high-risk areas for professional or medical purpose
Comment: Exceptions to the quarantine: requirement Now also exempt from the quarantine requirement are those working in culture after a cultural event, athletes after a competition and participants in specialist congresses. The prerequisite for this is that a specific protection concept is drawn up and implemented for the event in question abroad. Also exempt from the quarantine requirement are people who have to travel to a risk area for professional or medical reasons and cannot be postponed. The prerequisite is that the stay abroad does not last more than five days and a protection concept is drawn up and implemented.

Measure_L2: Secure future access to anti-Covid19 medication and vaccine
Comment: Switzerland is committed to a global solution for the fair distribution of future Covid-19 vaccines. The COVAX initiative, led by GAVI, CEPI and the World Health Organization (WHO), aims to provide around two billion vaccine doses. On September 18, 2020, Switzerland confirmed its participation in the COVAX initiative in order to procure vaccines for 20 percent of its population.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: Tracing, testing, isolation, quarantine - these measures are the focus of the new sub-campaign of the Federal Office of Public Health (FOPH) to contain the new coronavirus. The campaign is aimed at the general population. The FOPH wants to motivate young people in particular with individual subjects and is thus breaking new ground: advertising is also on Tinder and the gamer platform twitch.tv, among other things.

Individual measures to maintain the judiciary, such as exceptionally the use of video conferences in negotiations and during the hearing of witnesses is still necessary and will therefore be extended. Parliament has approved the creation of the necessary basis for this under the Covid Act. At the same time, the regulations will be adapted to the changed epidemiological situation. They are valid until December 31, 2021 at the latest.

In order to avoid cases of hardship in road traffic due to the coronavirus pandemic, FEDRO issued exceptional regulations in spring 2020. For example, people were allowed to continue driving vehicles despite their expired driver's license, or holders of a proficiency certificate were allowed to transport people and goods despite a lack of further training. These exceptions are ending now.

Measure_L4: Authorities approval and submission of protection concept
Comment: Large events can be held again if they have the cantonal approval. A protection concept must be submitted for every event with more than 1000 people. Strict guidelines must be observed. With a few exceptions, seats are compulsory and the flow of people must be clearly regulated. For games in the national ice hockey and football leagues, mask requirements and capacity restrictions also apply. The cantons can revoke permits if the epidemiological development worsens.

Large events can be held again if they have the cantonal approval. A protection concept must be submitted for every event with more than 1000 people. Strict guidelines must be observed. With a few exceptions, seats are compulsory and the flow of people must be clearly regulated. For games in the national ice hockey and football leagues, mask requirements and capacity restrictions also apply. The cantons can revoke permits if the epidemiological development worsens.

Measure_L3: Lift ban on indoor sport events
Measure_L4: National ice hockey and football leagues. With masks
Comment: Large events can be held again if they have the cantonal approval. A protection concept must be submitted for every event with more than 1000 people. Strict guidelines must be observed. With a few exceptions, seats are compulsory and the flow of people must be clearly regulated. For games in the national ice hockey and football leagues, mask requirements and capacity restrictions also apply. The cantons can revoke permits if the epidemiological development worsens.

First authorization application for a COVID-19 vaccine submitted in Switzerland Swissmedic has started the scientific assessment of the first COVID-19 vaccine. The application for approval was submitted in early October 2020 by AstraZeneca, which is developing the vaccine in collaboration with Oxford University.

Measure_L3: Combat the trade in illegal drugs and medical devices
Comment: The Federal Customs Administration (FCA) and Swissmedic have participated in a coordinated, global campaign to combat the trade in illegal drugs and medical devices. Since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic, there have been an increasing number of counterfeit and inferior products in circulation. As part of the campaign, the FCA and Swissmedic checked 29 consignments with a total of 132 tons of medical face masks.

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support tourism, sport and culture sectors
Comment: The Federal Council has passed the Covid-19 Culture Ordinance. This stipulates that the federal government will continue to provide the cantons with funds to support cultural enterprises. Financial assistance to compensate for financial losses is granted upon request.

Convoy of the Swiss Humanitarian Aid with 19 trucks to the needy population in the conflict area of eastern Ukraine in the Donetsk region. A significant part of the aid delivery consists of medical material to overcome the Covid crisis

Measure_L2: Secure future access to anti-Covid19 medication and vaccine
Comment: He has signed a contract with the British pharmaceutical company AstraZeneca and the Swedish government for the delivery of up to 5.3 million vaccine doses. This gives the Swiss population access to another Covid-19 vaccine, provided the clinical test phase and approval by Swissmedic are successful.

Measure_L4: Return to ordinary laws for enterprises
Comment: The Federal Council will not extend the temporary measures to prevent corona-related bankruptcies. With the Covid-19 regulation on insolvency law of April 16, 2020, the Federal Council temporarily suspended companies' obligation to report overindebtedness. At the same time, he created the temporary, unbureaucratic Covid-19 deferral, especially for SMEs. The Federal Council wanted to avert corona-related bankruptcies and give companies time to adjust to the new situation. The measures are limited to six months and apply until October 19, 2020.

It is compulsory to wear a mask in publicly accessible interiors, for example in shops, shopping centers, banks, post offices, museums, libraries, cinemas, theaters, concert halls, interiors of zoological and botanical gardens and animal parks, restaurants, bars, discos, gaming rooms, hotels (with the exception of Guest rooms), entrance and cloakroom rooms of swimming pools, sports facilities and fitness centers, in medical practices, hospitals, churches and religious institutions, advice centers and quarters. It is also mandatory to wear a mask in those parts of the public administration that are accessible to the public. The obligation to wear a face mask only applies in compulsory schools, schools in upper secondary and tertiary level, in institutions for supplementary childcare and in the training areas of sports and fitness facilities if it is provided for in the relevant protection concept.

Anyone who is older than 12 years on public transport has to wear a face mask since July 6, 2020. This obligation is now being extended to people who are in public transport access points. As before, people who cannot wear a mask for medical reasons are exempt from the obligation to wear a mask

Anyone who is older than 12 years on public transport has to wear a face mask since July 6, 2020. This obligation is now being extended to people who are in public transport access points. As before, people who cannot wear a mask for medical reasons are exempt from the obligation to wear a mask

Measure_L3: Restriction on private and familial events
Comment: Events with family and friends should be avoided if possible. At private events with more than 15 people, consumption will only be allowed while sitting. Anyone who is not in their seat must wear a mask. In addition, the general hygiene rules must be observed and the contact details collected. Private events with over 100 people must have a protection concept analogous to public events, and they may only be carried out in publicly accessible facilities.

Spontaneous gatherings of more than 15 people are prohibited in public spaces, in particular in public places, on walking paths and in parks. In particular, this is to prevent private events from being relocated to public spaces. Organized events in public spaces are still allowed with the appropriate protective measures, such as political and civil society rallies.
The consumption of food and drinks in restaurants and nightlife venues such as bars or clubs is only allowed while seated, regardless of whether it is indoors or outdoors.

Measure_L4: Place of work may only be entered if work cannot be done at home
Comment: Employers are obliged to observe the home office recommendations of the Federal Office of Public Health. Working at home can avoid large gatherings of people, especially at rush hour, and reduce close contacts at work. It also reduces the risk of entire work teams having to be quarantined in the event of a Covid 19 case.

Extension of the provisional debt restructuring moratorium from October 20, 2020. Regardless of the corona pandemic, the parliament decided on June 19, 2020 as part of the revision of stock corporation law to adapt Article 293a of the Debt Enforcement and Bankruptcy Act (SchKG): The total duration of the provisional debt restructuring moratorium will be extended from four to eight months. This is intended to facilitate the restructuring of companies, which can also be important in times of crisis. The Federal Council is therefore putting the relevant change in the law into force on October 20, 2020. The remaining parts of the company law reform will come into force at a later date.

With regard to possible missions in the current Corona situation, the army is suspending the major troop exercises planned for this year. With this measure, the operational readiness is focused with regard to possible operations for the benefit of the civil authorities.
The operation of discos and dance halls is prohibited. These carry an increased risk of spreading the virus

Measure_L4: Limit up to 4 persons per table and social distancing
Comment: In restaurants and bars, a maximum of four people are allowed to sit at one table, with the exception of parents with children. There is a curfew from 11 p.m. to 6 a.m.
Trade fairs and markets may no longer be held indoors.

Events with more than 50 people are no longer allowed. This applies to all religious, sporting, cultural and other events, with the exception of parliamentary and community assemblies. Political demonstrations and the collection of signatures for referendums and initiatives are still possible, as before, a mask is required. Since a particularly large number of droplets are emitted when singing, all occasions for amateur choirs are prohibited, professional choirs are allowed to rehearse.

Political demonstrations and the collection of signatures for referendums and initiatives are still possible, as before, a mask is required. Since a particularly large number of droplets are emitted when singing, all occasions for amateur choirs are prohibited, professional choirs are allowed to rehearse.

Measure_L3: Restriction on private and familial events
Comment: The number of people for events with family and friends in private rooms is limited to 10.

Events with more than 50 people are no longer allowed. This applies to all religious, sporting, cultural and other events, with the exception of parliamentary and community assemblies. Political demonstrations and the collection of signatures for referendums and initiatives are still possible, as before, a mask is required. Since a particularly large number of droplets are emitted when singing, all occasions for amateur choirs are prohibited, professional choirs are allowed to rehearse.

Sports and cultural leisure activities are permitted indoors with up to 15 people, provided that sufficient distance can be maintained and masks are worn. A mask can only be dispensed with if there is generous space, for example in tennis halls or large halls. Outdoors, e.g. when jogging, you just have to keep the distance. Contact sports in the leisure sector are prohibited everywhere. Children under the age of 16 are exempt from the rules, even in compulsory school.

Measure_L4: Outdoor areas of businesses and facilities
Comment: A mask must be worn in the outdoor areas of facilities and businesses, for example in the outdoor areas of shops and event locations, on terraces in restaurants and bars and at weekly and Christmas markets.
A mask requirement applies in busy pedestrian areas, e.g. in shopping streets in inner cities, and wherever the required distance in public spaces cannot be maintained.
In schools from upper secondary level, it is now mandatory to wear a mask.
A mask requirement also applies at the workplace, unless the distance between the workplaces can be maintained (e.g. individual offices).
Employers should as far as possible enable home office and ensure the protection of employees at workplaces.

The coordinated medical service KSD has a common concept for the national coordination of the intensive care units with other actors of the health system. The aim is to take over the COVID-19 pandemic via a central coordination point.
Universities must basically switch to distance learning from now on.
Rapid antigen tests are also used to enable broader and faster testing of the population. More positive cases in the population can be quickly detected and isolated.

Measure_L2: Educate and actively communicate with the public
Comment: The Federal Office of Public Health (FOPH) is launching a new sub-campaign referring to the coronavirus check. Whoever does this check receives a recommendation regarding a coronavirus test. The BAG coronavirus campaign has also switched to red.

The Federal Council has decided to support the health system with up to 2500 army members in the assistance service. The services of the army include the following areas. 1) Caring for low-level care patients, such as in the pre-diagnosis, the screening of suspected Covid-19 cases and test smears 2) personal and material support of the cantonal health facilities in expanding the capacities of intensive care units, e.g. Ventilators and monitoring 3) Support for the transport of infectious patients. The resolution is valid until March 31, 2021 at the latest

Measure_L3: Develop all-of-society and business continuity plans
Measure_L4: Support professional and semi-profesional team sports
Comment: Professional and semi-professional team sports in Switzerland are suffering heavily from the consequences of the Covid 19 pandemic. Thanks to a federal aid package, clubs can be supported directly by the federal government with loans totaling CHF 350 million.

Measure_L3: Quarantine for people arriving from Wuhan with severe cases of pneumonia
Comment: The Taiwan Centers for Disease Control (Taiwan CDC) pointed out that during the Ministry of Health and Welfare Infectious Disease Control and Prevention Advisory Committee: Division of Influenza Control and Prevention Meeting in Preparedness to Potential Influenza Outbreak during the Chinese New Year Holiday held on January 2, 2020, participating experts discussed the ongoing pneumonia outbreak in Wuhan, China. The experts recommended that in addition to the existing measure of onboard quarantine inspection, all healthcare facilities should reinforce case reporting of clinically severe cases of pneumonia among people who arrive in Taiwan from Wuhan, and all healthcare workers should strictly adhere to standard precautions for preventing nosocomial infection, wearing N95 respirators as required while performing invasive medical procedures such as intubation and tracheostomy.

Comment: Starting from tomorrow (March 12 ), all foreign tourists arriving at all international airports in Thailand will be required to download an AOT Airports application onto their mobile phones as a measure to contain the spread Covid-19 in the country. The requirement also applies to Thai returnees from high risk countries.The measure was agreed at a meeting of the Digital Economy and Society Ministry, the National Broadcasting and Telecommunications Commission, the Immigration Bureau, the Department of Disease Control, Airports of Thailand and five telecom operators.Once the app is downloaded, they will have to fill in the required information - name, surname, passport ID , mobile phone number, e-mail address and present them to the immigration officials on duty . The information will be stored for 14 days after arrival.

Measure_L2: Measures to ensure security of supply
Measure_L3: Prohibition of the hoarding of goods
Comment: It is prohibited for any person to hoard goods which are medicine, medical supplies, food, drinking water, or any other goods that are necessary for daily consumption and use, whether classified as controlled goods under the Price of Goods and Services Act B.E. 2542 (1999) or not.

It is prohibited to assemble, to carry out activities, or to gather at any place that is crowded, or to commit any act which may cause - 4 - unrest in areas determined by the Chief Officer responsible for remedying the emergency situation on matters relating to security.

It is prohibited to present or disseminate news through any media featuring content on the communicable disease Coronavirus 2019 (COVID-19) which is false or may instigate fear among the people, or to intentionally distort information which causes misunderstanding of the emergency situation to the extent of affecting the public order or good moral of the people. In such cases, officials shall issue warnings to cease such acts or order to correct such news, or in cases where there are severe impacts, shall instigate a proceeding in accordance with the Acts on Commission of Offences Relating to Computer Act B.E. 2550 (2007) or the Emergency Decree on Public Administration in Emergency Situations B.E. 2548 (2005)

Measure_L3: Recommend to prepare to receive patients
Comment: Hospitals, medical centres, or any relevant agencies, in both the public and private sectors, that have duties and powers in the protection and treatment of patients, shall procure adequate supplies of medication, medical supplies, medical examination equipment, respiratory equipment, and other necessary equipment in accordance with the standards or recommendations of the Ministry of Public Health.

The following groups of people that are at high risk of infection from COVID-19 shall stay in their dwelling places or within the area of their residences, in order to protect themselves from infection from the outside environment: (1) Elderly Persons over 70 years of age. (2) Persons who have underlying health conditions, namely chronic noncommunicable diseases, such as diabetes, hypertension, coronary artery and cerebrovascular diseases, respiratory system diseases, and persons who are immunocompromised caused by a natural history of disease and medication. (3) Young children under five years of age
The cleaning by wiping surfaces of relevant places before the organisation of activities and the disposal of waste on a daily basis

Comment: Persons in (2) shall wash their hands with soap, alcohol, gel or disinfectant.
